Reviews.Title: “not so bad”
Reviews.Author: AsiaPro
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 night stay in the Hudson Hotel. I was reading some bad reviews and was worried. Bottom line with this hotel is, if you know what is waiting for you it is not so bad. Rooms are definitely small but clean and the bed is good (but short). Bathroom fine as we but small as well. I got a room in the 23rd floor so noise from the bar was not an issue. Rooms have wirless internet which was a plus. If you get a good deal in the hotel it is certainly a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hudson's not for everyone but I liked it !”
Reviews.Author: LGuo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hudson last August, and was very nervous, having read some really bad reviews . Yes, the rooms were awfully small and a tad claustophobic, but the hip bars more than made up for it. Stayed there alone by myself briefly last year, went shopping in the day, met my friends at the lobby bar at night. Loved the roofgarden where you can relax, read a book and order a cocktail. The lobby is quite dark, but the decor certainly quite unusual and very chic. Service was generally quite good. This is a hotel which you will like if you stay for a short time ( I stayed for a weekend ) and if you're young ,chic and trendy. Not for the more conservative. Lots of bars in the hotel, so it's paradise for those who love to drink. The gym was servicable, but no great shakes. I would return, but only if I was travelling by myself, and for a day or weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Starck!”
Reviews.Author: Roam-and-Home
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hudson, despite the reviews! And had a great time! The hotel was packed with EURO visitors that flew in for THE GATES in Central Park! The place was buzzing and the staff very attentive. Yes the bathrooms are small, but how much time do you need to spend in there!! The only issue we had was trying to get in / out of an elevator with the place filled to capacity! I recommend staying here at least once, after all, like the restaurants, there are just too many places to choose from to go back to the same place twice!

Reviews.Title: “sleep in a chic night club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hudson has a great night club bar and restaurant but the accomadation side is just ok we travel alot and often stay in 5 star places this is not 5 star its pricey for what it offers even in new york it is in a great location but rooms are small even the bigger rooms which is what we had didnt worry me but my husband hated the smallness the security is good but its busy and nothing special an ok if not noisy experience outside is noisy but so is the air conditioner brissy couple , ausralia

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: MagAnt
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hudson with jetlag to find that our room had vanished and we would be transferred to a suite for one night only. The suite was lovely - which meant that our transfer to a smaller room was all the more painful - even though we had been warned in advance to expect a shoe box. It barely had room for all the shoe boxes containing my shopping! The breakfast buffet was cold - it was safer to stick to the muffins than try the cooked breakfast. Where the hotel did score, however, was in terms of location and cocktail ambience. It was a short walk from many of the best shops and restaurants in New York and the perfect place for an unfashionably early cocktail each evening before venturing out (Just don't look at the bill too closely). We liked the funky reception, lobby bar and library bar - somehow it felt like the middle of the night, even during the day! We did have a fantastic weekend - but I'm not sure if we would stay in the Hudson again.

Reviews.Title: “Delivers what it promises”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I hadn’t stayed at the Hudson recently and we were pleasantly surprised. For those of you not familiar with it, the Hudson is the modern, minimalist hip hotel offering micro-sized rooms in a fantastic Upper West Side location. I remember thinking the service was somewhat impersonal the last time I was here, but this time around everyone seemed friendly and willing to help. The rooms are tiny. The hotel says they are “modeled on a cruise ship cabin” and they ain’t kidding. Still, the design of the rooms is very interesting. The bathroom was tiny and yet looked modern and the hotel supplied high quality amenities. The bed was comfortable and fitted with high quality linens. And in the hotel’s defense, my girlfriend didn’t think the rooms were as small as I did. Like a lot of “hip” hotels, the Hudson is dark. Everyone looks better in dark, indirect lighting, and so does everything. Including hotel hallways and furnishings. It did not escape our notice that the hotel covers up some blemishes with dark lighting. Still, it works and it didn’t bother us. Or I should say I didn’t mind it. I think my girlfriend thought they should brighten things up a little. The lobby and bar downstairs is not to be missed if for no other reason than the fact that they have some wonderful people-watching. We spent a couple hours gawking at the hipsters and drinking the only moderately overpriced martinis in the fairly crowded watering hole. The place was busy and we were there on a random Tuesday night. There are times when the hotel seems a bit much. In the morning I felt like searching the hallways for the light switch – no need to keep it so dark at 8:00 AM. And the hotel posts a bouncer by the elevators, ostensibly to keep bar guests from wandering upstairs, but it seemed a bit affected. And the hotel has no signage outside which makes it seem like it’s trying a bit too hard. Still, I like the Hudson. I maintain it’s one of the best bargains in New York (we paid a paltry $160 - a corporate rate - for a night in a prime New York location). I challenge anyone to find a better value. The small size of the rooms can feel a little claustrophobic, but the Hudson isn’t for people who want to spend lots of time in their rooms. It’s a place to crash after a crazy night in New York. And it’s perfect for that.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Are you old or boring or without a sense of style? If so book into a safe, standard throughout the world "Comfort Inn" and you'll be happy. Young at heart, stylish and have sense of fun and adventure? Look no further than the Hudson. We spent our honeymoon at the Hudson for 1 week and loved it. Yes the drinks are over-priced. Yes the rooms are tiny. Yes it's noisy at weekends. YOU'RE IN NEW YORK CITY!!! What do you expect?! The public areas are fabulous particlarly the library where you can sip on a $7 beer whilst chilling out by the open fire and shooting pool or playing chess. Then off to the fantastic bar for a $9 cocktail and a glorious surrounding. The staff are very helpful. The location is central near Columbus Circle and the subway. If you're British take your own kettle and there is only a shower no bath. Overall we loved the Hudson and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it, although not to our parents!

Reviews.Title: “You'll definitely have an opinion about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tilbee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel after I "blind booked" it on Hotwire. I was not familiar with the hotel so I immediately went to TripAdvisor for some info. After reading the reviews, I was very worried that we would hate it. At least the TripAdvisor info prepared me for how small the rooms were or I would have thought someone was playing a joke on us when we opened the door to our room. It was so ridiculously small that it seemed funny to us, and that gave us a lighthearted approach to our stay. We didn't plan on spending much time in the room and they fortunately were able to squeeze a bed in it. You're basically talking about a room with a queen size bed and just enough room to squeeze around it...providing you don't set a suitcase on the floor. From a design standpoint, the Hudson is obviously going for a cool/chic/trendy approach; however, it is done in a very eclectic way. Overall, we liked the feel of the lobby and public areas which were a mix of cool lighting effects and a dark lodge-like decor. The Library room has a pool table surrounded by comfy couches and chairs, and was a nice place to wind down at the end of the day. The outdoor courtyard area was open but a little too chili for us to sit outside. It did appear to be a pretty cool setting however. We did also have dinner one night at the hotel restaurant and we both liked our meal. Overall, the one thing I can say about the Hudson is that it is unique. The design is truly eclectic and probably much more likely to appeal to the younger crowd. Although the room was ridiculously small (and noisy at night), I didn't hate it; I was almost amused by it. It did have some cool night lights but the 13" TV was a big disappointment. If they would put small plasma TVs in the rooms, it might be just enough of a cool factor to forgive the fact that there's only about 8" between the front of the toilet seat and the wall. The bed was fine but not up to the new standards that many of the better hotels have upgraded to. When the bed "is the room", you should give the customer a great bed and a plasma TV to truly qualify as a chic hotel. The location is fairly good, just a block west of the AOL towers on 58th where there is a nicer subway stop. If you don't care for the trendy/eclectic design of this hotel you'll probably hate it. If you like the trendiness, you'll probably find it's flaws to be tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 2 nights on our way out of America - absolutely dreadful. We asked and asked about getting the uncontrollable heating switched off to no avail. The second night we slept with the window open, it was snowing outside and it was still the most uncomfortably hot night's sleep that I could remember (and I've travelled to some hot places!)

Reviews.Title: “Tiny is an Understatement”
Reviews.Author: pontifex
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks, and I was never able to get over the size of the rooms - however, the staff was top-notch and the maid service was amazing. The hotel grounds left too much to be desired to justify the rate they charge. While checking in on my first night, you have to yell to be able to hear the front-desk staff because of the club music blaring in the backround. I was tired and ready for bed, and was very surprised to learn that the first floor lobby basically turns into an uber-chic club after dark. (Maker's Mark on ice was $16). When I walked into my standard room, I was expecting small, but what I got was TINY!!! I understand that Manhattan, on average, has smaller rooms than anywhere else in the U.S. (about 265 sq. ft), but this place is ridiculous! I measured the room for my own amusement and was tickled when I learned the whole room (bathroom, bedroom, closet, hallway) was 140 square feet!!!! If you ever have to use the toilet, your knees will touch the opposite wall when you sit down - and I'm only 5'9. If you are above average height, then you will have to literally fold yourself in half when you use the bathroom. Another thing that baffled me was you can't open the front door if the bathroom door is open... and vice versa. I kept thinking how ridiculous it would have been to have TWO people in the same room - don't even think about it! Overall, the Hudson was a decent hotel... very stuck-on-itself and very costly, but the location and guest service were above average. I'm staying at the Marriott Marquis next time and was very pleased to hear that their standard rooms are about 425 square feet.

Reviews.Title: “Don‘t believe everything you see or read”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hudson 5 days in April of 2005 when it was the only 70-80 degree days in April. The beautiful looking Sky Terrace and the Private Park at the Hudson were not available...can you believe that? That’s half the reason we opted for this place. We couldn’t partake on one of the only nice outdoor scenic views overlooking Central Park or have a glass of wine on the “enclosed” Private Park. Work out facility was a joke...tv’s headphones, and some equipment were broken. Only three elavators were working at times making many guests wait up to 10 minutes to get up to their rooms, staff was lethargic at best, get your specticles out because to see the 13 inch tv from your bed is quit tuff. And don’t be put near a stairway, a ice despenser, or one of their bar areas if you’re expecting any sleep. We waited over an hour for a corkscrew opener for our wine...calling and requesting the help desk, manager, and concierge 4 times. If you want “CHIC” and “VALUE” and like being treated as a customer and not a number stay at the W Hotels in NYC. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Miniscule, pretentious, poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes it's small, yes we were warned but think small....then half it. Great idea but spoiled by shortcuts where it counted. Ladies if you are planning on taking more than 5 couture dresses on hangers, along with micro lingerie and sandals do not stay here. If you are travelling with a suitcase,partner,child,parent,soon to be ex partner, do not stay here If you want to be able to close your bathroom door to dry your hair don't stay here If you like to unpack, don't stay here If you want to see your face to apply your makeup don't stay here If you want to get acclimatised to a trip in the space shuttle stay here If you are testing yourself to see if the $500 on hypnotherapy worked to cure your claustrophobia stay here If you are one of the young beautiful people who like to be seen stay here If you wish to boil because your air conditioning is so old and noisy stay here If you wish a great location stay here If you don't mind hit and miss housekeeping stay here If you want to cut your feet on the flooring that has warped and spilt stay here AS you may tell we felt there were more lows than highs at this hotel. It is in a good location, staff were pretentious and hotel geared to young people, partying and drinking. Unless you really like to share your bathroom habits with the one you love dont share a room or stay here!! Never again

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Small!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms were soooo small! You could barely move in the bathroom either a bigger person would struggle. The room didn't have a fridge for the minibar, it was all stacked in a drawer! (warm bottled water!) Also the air conditioning units make awful loud 'clanging' noises. On the otherhand the actual hotel was lovely, very 'urban chic'...also very clean. Although I did enjoy my stay at the Hudson, I would only recommend it for 'small' single people.

Reviews.Title: “Perplex”
Reviews.Author: supernovea
Reviews.Content: As described by others, the room is very small. However, I wasn't in NY to stay in a hotel room so it was ok. However, I would have liked the bathroom to be a little larger and more pratical. The shower/tub was a bit annoying because of the two curtains (one on each side). Moreover, the housekeeping wasn't that good and the morning we left, they knocked twice on the door to ask at what time we were leaving... that's not very professional considering that it wasn't close to checkout time. I would consider staying again if no better hotels are available.

Reviews.Title: “Way too small for comfort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am just appalled at the price I had to pay for a room that size. My husband and I don't mind spending money that is justified, but the room put a damper on our trip to NYC. Yes, rooms in Europe are small, but we are not in Europe! There was no room to move, breathe, shower use the toilet, etc!! The rest of the hotel is awesome, and that is the reason we decided to stay there... but it was not worth it, and we will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend stay at the Hudson. The location is great. 1 Block to Central Park and 3 to Carnegie Hall. The rest needs work. The room was so small I could touch both sides at the same time, the shears that were used for privacy in the shower may look chic but are impractical when they are blowing all over the place when the shower is in use, the bed had a metal box spring that made me believe I was sleeping on a military cot based on the amount of noise it made. Room was a bit worn with peeling paint and lack of electrical outlets. The elevators seem to malfunction on a regular basis. Staff was helpful and friendly. Bar was a happening place. For a couple on a weekend maybe, for a family or someone on a business trip not likely. None of the outdoor spots was open even thought the weather was in the 70's

Reviews.Title: “Always my favourite NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've never been disappointed - if you ignore the staff who think they are superstars in black. Great location, rooms, bars, food, restaurants. I little bit of chic luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bobinlondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks stay at the Hudson in New York. After reading the reviews on here I was slightly worried about staying there. However this was easily the best and most stylish hotel i have stayed in anywhere in the world. yes the rooms are small but so are many other hotel rooms in new york and london, but they had great beds and lighting. The public spaces, bars, restaurants etc are fantastic. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpfull. If you find the telephones in the rooms too expensive then use the many public ones in the hotel. There are a couple of great diners on the block for inexpensive breakfast and coffee. The location is second too none, on the doorstep of central park. I am a 45 year old man and travelled around a fair bit and i loved this place. If it is a bog standard boring hotel you are after with chintzy rooms, then stay away from the Hudson, you will find plenty of them elsewhere in New york. For everyone else, you will love this place. Be sure too check out the Time Warner building accross the road. Fantastic food hall/deli in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Hudson - over priced, over rated and pretentious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over priced, over-rated and pretentious. As a first time visitor to New York I was extremely disappointed by the Hudson. $345 per night (supposedly including breakfast but apparently not when the bill was paid!). An extremely dark and miserable environment. Very small rooms, no cupboards, little hanging space, shower room 3ft by 6ft, dark, continual static problems. Housekeeping poor - torn bed covers, thin and small towels, cheap tissue. Dining service appalling e.g. breakfast plates soaking wet. One even had a butter wrap left on it after washing. Hot food only luke warm. Regularly had static shocks from door handles - problem management have been aware of for over 12 months. Also had severe shock one morning from lift button - shooting blue sparks. Complaining to the management - pointless!

Reviews.Title: “Hudson Hotel - Close to Central Park”
Reviews.Author: Cathy918
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I celebrated her 21 birthday at the Hudson. We stayed for one week. The hotel has a great location. It is very close to Central Park, which was a plus, and getting around on the train was easy. The hotel appearance from outside was okay. I was expecting something a little more chic. Inside it was decorated nice but dark. I felt like I was at a nightclub all the time. The rooms are extremly small. both my daughter and I are slim and petite, and we still bumped into each other. The rooms were also very dark; it was hard to put your make-up on. There weren't any dresser drawers or any place to put your underclothes. We pretty much had to live out of our suitcase. They did,howerver, provide you with a small closet. Showering was another whole exprience. The shower is small and has curtains on both sides of you, so everytime I moved around the curtains would stick to my skin. The bathroom was very small I could almost touch the wall in front of me with my face and knees. I wondered if it was code compliance? If you are a large person, you better think twice. In the bathroom there was now place to do your hair. The decor in the room was Akia style (Sweedish) okay but a little cheap looking. Housekeeping was not to great. The first night housekeeping forgot to put a sheet on my bed and a few times the maid didn't empy out my garbage can; she also didn't bother to sweep or dust sometimes. The view on the roof was great. The bar was nice, but we never got a chance to spend anytime there because it was always very busy. I would not recommend this hotel. I will be back to N.Y but not to the Hudson. Sincerely, C.H. from the Westcoast

Reviews.Title: “For a young, hip crowd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hudson Hotel on business. I was surprised that we had a business meeting there. There are some meeting rooms on the lower level. When I first entered the hotel (at 2 pm), there was disco music playing loudly and the feel was much more of a club than a hotel. I thought I must be in the wrong place! The staff were all very courteous and helpful. I had an upper level room, which I would recommend if you are interested in sleeping. Others in my group were on the lower 4 floors and could hear the club music all night. The rooms were well-equipped, but tiny. I felt like I was on a cruise ship. Paneled walls on either side of a double bed, which was actually like a futon rather than a standard boxspring/mattress combination. There was a tiny desk, which I could not even sit at with my laptop. I actually doubled over with laughter upon first seeing the bathroom- everything was miniaturized! The tub was approx 2/3 of a normal tub size with a clear window that was open to the room. This could be a problem if you are sharing a room with a colleague or friend. There was a pedestal sink, toilet and a shelf or two, squeezed into approx 3 feet of space. I am a small person, so was able to navigate fine. However, I was glad my 6'2" husband wasn't with me- his knees surely would have hit the wall if sitting on the toilet. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay. Great ambience downstairs, quite a club scene. Easy walking distance to many things I was interested in seeing. However, this is more of an "experience" than a hotel. I would not take young children to this place, and honestly if on business would stay elsewhere. The desk was just not practical for working on a laptop, and the bed wasn't comfortable enough to sit and work there very easily. If you are with a young, hip group of people, this may be the place for you! But it is really not practical to share these tiny rooms with others in your group if you care about privacy or personal space at all.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, dark corridors, not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hudson rooms are, as other people have mentioned, absolutely tiny and those on the lower floors are ridiculously noisy. The corridors are always dark and anyone with claustrophobia of any kind should avoid this hotel entirely. The bars are lively though and the public spaces are attractive but for the money I'd definitely recommend staying in a more traditional hotel with larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel, tiny room but comfy bed...”
Reviews.Author: capecodder16
Reviews.Content: this is a great place if you're out with friends, out for the atmoshere, food, drink, bar scene at the hotel but only go to your room to sleep. The beds are super comfy, all white liens, down comforters etc but you cant do anything else but enter your room and flop on your bed --its tiny!If the price was right, id stay here again becuz of its location and comfy bed, but otherwise, id look eleswhere....

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: The public areas of this hotel are better than the rooms, which are so tiny that your leg hits the wall when you get out of bed, and your foot hits the toilet when you get out of the shower!! There's no place to put your stuff in these rooms, and the entire hotel is very dark. The staff acts as if you're lucky to be staying at their precious hotel, instead of treating you like a guest. Not a very pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Go to the Hudson for a drink...but do not stay there. Rooms are so small that you feel like you're on a ship. Our first room, which was supposed to be non-smoking, smelled like smoke. So we were given a different non-smoking room...which also smelled like smoke. It took over an hour for our bags to be delivered to our room. TV remote was broken. Didn't have a hairdryer or robe, which we were supposed to.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience Love It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from my St Patrick Day stay in the Hudson. It is definitely a New York Experience with the hall way painted black - Rooms are spotless, very contemporary. Staff were down to earth and very very friendly with a concierge to help you with all times. The Main Bar is definitely the Sex in the city episode with Drink at an extroadinary prices example glass of white wine 12 dollars. Be prepared for an expensive nte out if you stay drinking in it for the nte. Close to subways and the shops ie Columbus Circle. Great diner on 58th and 9th- OVERALL WONDERFUL HOTEL do stay

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Chic, Fashionable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night stay at this Hotel with 3 other couples. We all had the same opinion....the Hotel staff very nice, the lobby and public rooms like the bar, the club and the library (with pool table) very nice touch. The rooms, beautiful, clean, but SMALL TINY MINISCULE that's what we all thought of our standard rooms. Beds have wonderfull clean sheets and comfortors (all white) dark wood floors, completely white washroom (very tiny) no drawers anywhere, the bed low on floor. Small place to hang clothes. It's okay for a short stay, the location was great, walking distance to Times Square, close to CNN & Trump Buildings. Parking expensive $46 per day. A little dark in the hallways, but it's done that way purposley to give it a unique look. Elevators, cool walls. This hotel was featured on the show "Sex and the City" room, bar & lobby. Wouldn't mind to get it again, but not too crazy about the size of the room no matter how clean and cute it was ! It would be great for people between 21-32....we are all between 45-47 so we appreciate comfort a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four day stay at the Hudson. My wife and I went to New York for our 5 year wedding anniversary. We used Priceline and we were somewhat worried once we received confirmation of the Hudson being the hotel we would be staying in. I checked numerous sites and found everything from good to horrible reviews of this hotel. Well let me set the story straight for you. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this charming trendy hotel. We arrived, and upon arrival before we even go out of our taxi, 2 bellman opened the doors and had our luggage in the hotel! We got in early that morning and our room would not be ready until the 3pm check in time, so we left our bags with the bellman and as we proceeded out into the rain/sleet/snow, the concierge handed us complimentary use of 2 umbrellas. So far so good! Once we checked in, I was worried about the size of the room. I was expecting the smallish room of a cruise line. But, the room was of adequate size. It had a queen bed with very nice linens, down comforter and 4 down pillows. It looked beautiful and had solid wood floors throughout the room. Very stylish, and very user friendly. Now, don't get me wrong, the room was small in comparison to what you might expect coming from another city, but it was in no way a hinderance to us enjoying this hotel. The location is superb, walking distance to everything, including central park, times square, and only 1 block from a subway hub which will get you anywhere! The staff at the hotel were wonderful down to earth people who went out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasant. All in all, the Hudson is a very trendy, stylish hotel with smaller rooms, but with everything you want from a hotel in New York. Location, friendly staff, and most important, it was very clean! Don't hesitate to stay here, especially if you are getting a great deal compared to other 3 or 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: miamiskyboy
Reviews.Content: Other than being trendy and chic. This hotel has nothing to offer. Upon the confusing check in, we finally made it to our small (150 Sq Ft) Room. There was a rat in the air conditioning controls and rat dropings next to the bed. The second room we where taken to had pubic hairs all over the bathroom, towels, and bedding sheets. We even had a hair in the cesar salad at the restaurant the next day. The staff was not apologetic and was very slow to respond to our concerns. The Hudson hotel and it's staff made for a terrible trip to New York, I advise everyone to never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hudson was a welcome respite from the hideous place we checked out of in order to come to it. Contemporary to its bones, we found the sleek decor and the subtle lighting inviting. The courteous staff tripped all over themselves to be of service to us regarding every aspect of our stay, from handling our bags to providing NYC information. The room size was adequate, with comfortable furnishings and well-planned aesthetic detail. When I return to NYC, I am definitely staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping in an orange crate!”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: This place is all style with (bad) attitude and no substance. Yeah the public rooms look great (provided you're equipped with night vision goggles) and the people are all beautiful people (Shrek look-alikes be warned!), but the rooms are dire! No space, no comfort, no working a/c, no where to move if more than one in the room. If you're used to sleeping in a box of orange crate - you'll love this place! Master Schrager has had his day and there are much better places to stay in NYC than this stylish (but tired) fruit box!

Reviews.Title: “One thing after another...”
Reviews.Author: BelmoTerr
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had -- for a hotel that is supposedly pretty nice. The rooms are tiny, but that was the least of my problems. The wireless internet was a mess -- I spent over two hours trying to get the service to work before I requested a new room. I had to call the front desk three times before the move was approved. I then had to wait 40 minutes for the move to happen, and the wireless service in the new room was in and out for the remainder of my stay. Key features of the new room: the heat was not working, the fire alarm was ripped out of the wall (wires sticking out in its place), and part of the wall was kicked in. The heat was finally fixed three phone calls and 6 hours later! The hotel staff was not responsive to problems at all -- when I called the front desk to explain a problem, they would abruptly transfer me to someone else without even allowing me to finish my sentence -- god forbid they would actually apologize for my problem! I travel a lot, and I'm quite used to dealing with a problem here or there at a hotel -- but this was just one thing after another, and the hotel staff made very little effort to make any of these problems go away. I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Vendredimanche
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before our trip and was slightly worried. We stayed at the Hudson 5 nights over New Year last December/ January. We upgraded to a King bed deluxe (290 USD) so space was not an issue, the room was quite spacious and there was a wardrobe to hang clothes. However I felt really let down by the bathroom - only a shower no bathtub. After a day walking around New York, you really feel like lounging around in a bath, and that was not an option... The other major issue was the noise. We were on the 4th floor and clearly not high enough to escape the buzz / police sirens / honks, etc of NYC! The worst, however, was the air conditioning system which must be ancient and kept gurgling all night. It kept us awake for most of the 1st night and we were told this would be fixed the next day. It was mildly better over the next few days, but still noisy. We had very little contact with the staff and kept ourselves to ourselves - even checked out via the TV system. It seemed more like a tiny studio in NYC than a luxury designer hotel. Will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Cubicle rooms with the bed on the floor”
Reviews.Author: kkeyser27
Reviews.Content: As is true for many Ian Shrager hotels, this place is unbelievably pretentious, yet does not live up to its own hype. My wife and I stayed here for a wedding in October- and the room was the size of a small closet! For what they charge I wasn't expecting a room where I could practically touch all four walls from the bed (which was on the floor) The rooftop is nice however- with great views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “delightfully different”
Reviews.Author: CeladonMaine
Reviews.Content: My family of four (children ages 8 & 10 and their parents) spent three nights her in February 2005. Every one of us loved this hotel. The lobby and all the common spaces were so comfortably cozy. Kids especially liked the library. Our room was quite spacious but I suspect it's because it was designed to accomodate a wheelchair (bars in shower and handheld showerhead). I really liked the hardwood floors with rugs as opposed to the ubiquitous hotel carpeting found in many hotels. Staff were all friendly and approachable. Concierge sent us to some good restaurants. The Hudson was a great place to return to after playing tourists all day in the February chill.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars with a caveat. Upgrade or you'll be mad”
Reviews.Author: nosescott
Reviews.Content: I love Ian Schrager hotels but he really has to do something about room sizes. Hudson is the place to be. Great space as usual, super pretty people at the bar but DO NOT stay in a standard rooms. Get a suite or you'll be sorry. TINY TINY rooms and bathrooms. Upgrade to a suite and you'll be much more comfy. Rooms are outstanding aside from size. Great lighting, great features. Always fun to stay at an Ian Schrager property if they're newer. But please, upgrade or else you'll hate it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hudson is like Marmite, love it or hate it!”
Reviews.Author: paolawilliamson1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hudson for two nights and were disappionted to find the rooms EXTREMELY SMALL! The lack of amenities in the room was shocking for the price paid! I have stayed in many wonderful and expensive hotels in the past and could not believe the poor quality for the price. If you take a big suticase you won't be able to fit it in the "deluxe" room, I wonder what the regular room is like!! A small TV, a stereo (which I enjoyed) no mini bar, so you can enjoy your $6 coke warm! The bathroom is so tiny you can barely get in! The bed was squeaky and there was a wire in the middle which nearly made me fall over. The maid also knocked franticly at 8:30!!! so unrespecful as she wanted to clean the room at that time. Overall this is a hotel to go and pose at the bar with the rest of the crowd who are there "to be seen" so beware if you are fat, ugly, old, uncool as people will stare at you! oh well, I'm sure you could just show your big wallet and they'll love you!

Reviews.Title: “Do not use the hotel phones!”
Reviews.Author: sophie fishing
Reviews.Content: The bars are undoubtedly trendy, the cocktails are terrific and the location is terrific. Staff were efficient and sometimes friendly. The standard rooms are very cosy ie there is barely space to walk around the bed but if you are with a loved one you'll enjoy the large comfy bed and subdued lighting. (If you are over 5'7" or over 150pounds though beware - the bathrooms are soooo tiny every movement has to be carefully coordinated or you will do yourself an injury. I am a slim 5'7" and my knees were jammed against the wall when i went to the loo and elbows pinned to my sides.) The gym is pretty basic. Main gripe: do not under any circumstances use the phones in the rooms. A local call costs $1.25 connection charge, long distance costs $10:97 connection charge and international costs $17 - just to connnect, with additional charges per minute. These long distance and international rates are out of proportion to other hotels in NY and are not made clear in the information in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “How to get a decent sized room at this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Occi0
Reviews.Content: The Hudson is an amusing, trendy hotel in a GREAT location with a friendly, efficient staff that suffers from having many miniscule rooms. To ensure a decent sized room just ask for one with two beds. The price is very little more and the rooms big enough to fit two beds are often wonderful with corner windows and plenty of room. Info from a visit of 4 days, Feb.10-14, 2005

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to spend a week at the Hudson for new year's eve week. I stayed at a 'super deluxe' room that was so small I could barely walk around my bed. Some of the fittings looked worn out and damaged, especially in the bathroom. I found the staff extremelly unfriendly and unhelpful. They refused to relocate me to a better room, even though I was prepared to pay for an upgrade. In the Grill restaurant, the staff were again extremelly rude and extremelly pushy in getting a suggested 22,5% service. The Hotel is expensive, and the amenities quite basic for this price range. The design of the Bars and Lobby is great, but unfortunatelly does not reflect on the low quality of the rooms. I felt this is a high price to pay for a supposedly trendy Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hudson during November 2004 and enjoyed the experience. The rooms were on the small side but when travelling from the UK to spend a long weekend in "The Big Apple", time in the bedroom was kept to an ABSOLUTE minimum. The decor was contemporary but extremely comfortable. The reception and bar areas had great vibes and the staff were very accommodating and helpful. One downside was the prices in the bar. If you're planning on spending an evening in the hotel bar, take plenty of "dosh" with you. The location of The Hudson could not be better for all sightseeing and facilities. Central Park just around the corner and Fifth Avenue a short walk away. NO real need for cabs! I WILL be travelling to New York again soon and wouldn't hesitate to book into The Hudson Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's Purpose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm very late in submitting this review. I stayed here during the weekend of the NYC Marathon in 2004 and hope to again in 2005. The Good: Was perfectly located for all the things that I needed/wanted to do to get ready for the race. And other places i.e. a great pizza joint, small supermarket, 24 hour coffee shop, CVS, etc. were right around the corner. The staff members were attentive and very friendly. They had internet access available in a common area, and the gym wasn't all that awful looking either (didn't use it, though). The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable...heaven! And on Marathon Morning, the staff had complimentary water and power bars downstairs at the check in/out area. Nice touch! But really, LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! That was key! I was really hurting the day after the race, and the staff was so nice in assisting me with my bags down the escalator. The Bad: Teeny-tiny television set, but then again, the room was very small, so a normal sized tv probably couldn't have fit in there. No small fridge, bath tub or coffee maker (all essentials for my pre- and post-race rituals). No dressers for clothes, small closet. For the most part, my clothes stayed in my suit cases. But hey, I got the room thru priceline, and at an awesome rate, so for NYC, you could do a LOT worse. The Ugly: Nothing....I loved the contemporary styling of the rooms and the hotel. My bathroom was spacious enough (although no tub...oh, how I needed a hot bath after the race, but that's ok). The club was opened until 3am or 4am, looked like a lot of fun (couldn't go...had to rest), and the noise stayed downstairs, which was great as it was critical that I got a good nite's sleep before the race. I've read other reviews pertaining to the dissatisfaction of some because of the room size, and yes, they are very tiny. But for me, the Hudson served it's purpose. It gave me a clean, quiet, COMFORTABLE place to sleep. I'd stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Hudson Hotel of NYC is hot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bar at this hotel is off the hook! The staff is incredibly friendly and efficient. The lobby is quite a memory. very cosmopoliton. A great memory.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: OakvilleFlyer
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a disappointing one night stay at the Hudson Hotel in New York City (January 11, 2005). My expectations for short stay rooms are simple: clean, with a comfortable bed and good shower. Friendly and accommodating staff are a bonus. My experience with the Hudson was lacking in many respects. My room was small, but there was no knocking its simplicity and clean lines. The bed was very comfortable. The peek-a-boo style bath was a neat stylistic touch. The problem that plagued me throughout my stay was an inability to control the temperature of the room. The problem was apparently unique to my unit (1931), as my colleagues had thermostats in theirs. When I checked in, it was freezing with a horrible draft coming from the closed window behind the bed. I mentioned the problem to the front desk before leaving for dinner and returned to nothing short of a sauna. My shower the next morning was terrible. The water simply trickled vertically from the showerhead and did little to freshen me up after a night in sweat. When asked how my stay was on checkout, I mentioned that it was not satisfactory and outlined why. The attendant offered repeated apologies - "I'm so sorry", "I'm so sorry about the issues", but offered nothing more. I was not expecting a free room by any means, but a semblance of sincerity would have been appreciated. I recognize that stays like mine are simply hit and miss bad luck. Nevertheless, there are far too many great hotels in the Big Apple to check out before I'd ever consider returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC AND BEAUTIFUL A GREAT GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous to book a room at the hudson after reading all the bad reviews. well I m glad I didn t follow my first feeling I made the best choice I could imagine. Everything was great from the moment I walked in thanks to the escalator under a yellow light to my early departure time 3 days later. I stayed there the 25-26-27jan. The lobby is huge beautiful in wood dark with a big chandelier. The library is FANTASTIC, the bar gives u the groove to go on at night, very stylish. My room was a superior room 170sqft for 170dol. Great comfort, great deal very well designed. Love the wood on the wall and the imaculate down comforter. The contrast is incredible. Love the lamp too on both sides of the bed. You feel like to be in a cabin of a cruise ship. The bathroom is small white like at the delano but with all amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful, thank you Kimberly to let me see the studio and deluxe studio. VERY VERY BEAUTIFUL. I was in buisness trip. The size of the room didn t bother me. I travel a lot. A lot of rooms in NYC are small. Or YOU just have to go in Paris or other cities in europe and you ll see. So all the comments about the size is for people who doesn t travel too much and have stayed only in the the same brand and same smell hotel that you can find all over the world nothing special. I was by myself so the superior room was really enough but I checked the studio and deluxe studio they are much bigger and VERY VERY NICE I ll call that a bit luxurious in dark wood and white bed and sofa. But a bit more expensive. Music, Trendy, comfort, clean friendly designed, and stylish qualified the HUDSON hotel. A lot of european are staying there. I wanted to find another kind of hotel, an hotel who can brings you to a different atmosphere and make you feel different. I found it. Don t pay attention to the dark coridor, who cares , but look at the little yellow light above each door. Don t pay attention the size of the room but open your mind and let you transported by the music the style and the design. The bar is wonderful, of course it s not cheap, 12dol the martini, but you re in new york and in a incredible atmosphere with a cool and good looking crowd. So who cares if you pay a couple of bucks more. You don t find that everywhere and you don t spend 12dol in a maritini everyday. So If you have an opened mind, If you have the experience of the same old hotel brand and you want something different, If you are ready to open your eyes to observe all the details of the design, the Hudson is for you. I had a great great time and I ll come back for sure. LOVED IT

Reviews.Title: “Tiny,Expensive, but Ecclectic”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghnative
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hudson Hotel near Central Park West from for a few days after Christmas. It's entrance goes almost unnoticed since the facade is plain, but the overhead treelimbed foyer, and mysteriously lit hallways and lounge are for those that enjoy an ecclectic ambiance over classic New York City grande hotels. The rooms are clean, but are very tiny, plain, and not worth the steep rate. The bathrooms are barely bigger than the small closet. The hallways are painted a dingy cement color, and the dimly lit hallways added to the gloom. For the price I expected more, and if I just wanted to find a plain clean room with a good location then the Comfort Inn in Times Square would have fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “98% of these reviews are wrong!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hudson Hotel from Dec 26-30, 2004. After reading all of these innacurately negative reviews I felt the need to share my experience. I had a wonderful time at this hotel. The atmosphere is brilliant (it was designed by Phillipe Stark). For a moment you wonder if you are taking part in "2001:Space Odyssey" as you ascend up the indirectly lit Chartreuse escalators. The lobby looks like a Tim Burton movie, with a massive chrystal hollographic chandelier. Aside from the beauty of the building, the staff is also attractive, friendly, and very attentive. I have noticed that many of the complaints about this hotel are the room size, music, lighting, parties, bars, etc... Well attention folks, you are staying at a hotel that was developed by one of the guys responsible for Studio 54, what did you expect? None of these complaints are valid as you can clearly go to the hotel website and know what to expect. The size of the rooms is small, pay a tiny bit more and opt for the Double Double (which I did). Even in the smaller rooms, however, there are cleverly designed hooks and shelves along with comfy beds. The music is actually great (techno, house, trance), the lighting is very dramatic unlike most other hotels, the parties sometimes include prominent people and celebrities, and the bars are all very unique. Most of the negative reviews are from people who should have known better than to stay here if their style is more traditional Waldorf Astoria. I will be returning to Manhattan in April and once again in July, and will definitely be staying at the Hudson both times!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach lovers' paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the rooms are on the small side but this really isn't the issue with this hotel. The service was simply non-existent. Staff were simply too cool to bother with simple courtesies. The low point was finding a cockroach in our room, asking for the room to be cleaned, and coming back to discover that this simple, straightforward and - to us Brits - not unreasonable request had not been carried out. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Not what i want a hotel to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Service poor. Heat low, and room smelled of bleach. you HAVE to upgrade the room and the hip chic style is just sad.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read countless reviews of the Hudson before being cornered really into booking since the Royalton was too pricey. So glad we stayed there. Stylish, not intimadating, friendly, etc etc. We were thrilled. We stayed on the 17th floor, which meant we were totally unaware of the music from downstairs bar (which was great fun). The room, though tiny, was compact, clean, fresh in its decor and very very pleasing. The location is great for uptown and had fantastic Sunday brunch in Central Park. Very dark hotel, ie dark wood etc so don't go if you like airy, clinical type design. Real treat of a hotel and not expensive especially considering we were there for New Year. Its also extremely well located for the top end shops at the Time Warner Complex literally down the road, which also houses a metro station. Ideal. Highly recommended especially for the under 40s.

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sure, the rooms are small and I would not want to stay in one with another person, but when traveling alone on business I love the Hudson. Very hip, the bar is great, and the restaurant while pricey is exceptional. This is definately a place where you can have a great time, IF you can get out of your everyday element, not worry about price for drinks, etc and just have a good time being among the young and hip.

Reviews.Title: “Hudson Slander”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, the disapointing reviews are a reflection of users expectations. Yes, the rooms are very small, Yes, it is basically a club atmosphere on the main floor during the evening, Yes, the hallways were dark, but overall knowing that it was an awesome place to play in NYC for the weekend. My wife and I (mid 20's) just spent 3 nights (1/6-1/9) there and had a blast, we booked a good rate ($160), had a good location, nice staff, and it was really fun knowing that there was always something going on in the hotel. I recomend this hotel to any age, my only caveat is that they must be young at heart. We will definetely return.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The terrific service and accommodations were more than we could ask for. We stayed 7 days along with our three teenagers who also had a great room. Concierge service, restaurant service and food, and the fabulous library were simply superb. The Hudson's location made it especially easy to access all of our first time destinations. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive mistake overall”
Reviews.Author: waltons39
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, but the space is cleverly used and most users only stay a few days. The lack of well lit open spaces for families to gather (as rooms are so small!!) was a problem for us. The only lit area was a very noisy and expensive, posey bar. We had some difficulties with service in trying to buy tickets for nye. Although the management made some efforts to put things right, we probably will use a different hotel next time. Expensive mistake overall.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: goodwig
Reviews.Content: Avoid this supposed nouveau-chic hotel, unless you are willing to sacrifice basic hotel services and room amenities in exchange for the the glitzy public areas where you pay $15.00 for a martini and ridiculous prices for average food. Rooms are midget-size, over-priced and neo-Spartan (?). I requested heat 5 times (including a promise from the hotel manager) and never got it. The maid knocked on the door at 8:15 a.m. Maybe she knew I was ready to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: FLLtraveler
Reviews.Content: Don't let the public spaces fool you; the rooms are a joke. Even an upgraded room was way too small for comfort and lacking in amenities. The poorly designed bathroom was all about looks over function--it failed on both counts. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “our floor and room reeked of room deodorizer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After enjoying a wonderful courtyard lunch at the Hudson in the early fall, I decided to book an overnight stay for our anniversary. I decided that the smaller than average room size wouldn't matter, which in fact, it didn't. What was offensive, however, was the overwhelming smell of the air freshener that greeted us the minute we walked off the elevator on to our floor, and followed us all the way into our room (smelled like the pungent cherry deodorizer in the ladies room at Penn Station.) When I went to look out our window at the view, I noticed that we were a few floors above a giant vent fan that was loud and spewing a foul odor, hence the need for the equally foul room deodorizer. I would recommend the hotel for a casual lunch, drinking, relaxing and people watching in its many charming areas indoors and out, but I would caution against an overnight stay before first checking out the room location.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the bad reviews, liked it!”
Reviews.Author: MelbGrrl
Reviews.Content: Despite reading all the negative comments on this site about the Hudson, my husband and I stayed here during the Republican Convention in August (although we weren't in New York for this reason) and loved it. We stayed for 5 nights in a queen room for $150 a night- a bargain in New York given the location and new-ness of the hotel. Yes it was small, but certainly not as tiny we imagined, and we live in a studio city apartment. Besides, New York is not a place where you come to just to sit in your room. The room itself was stylish, well designed for it's size, clean and quiet. The only complaint we might have was that the key tended to stick in the lock which made opening the door noisy. We also did not have any of the issues stated by other people on this site about the bathroom's size, and my husband is 6'2. The bedlinens and towels were of a good quality and the beds heavenly after 26 hours flying. The communal spaces are beautiful and are what makes the hotel. Yes, the hallway is dark, but well lit enough- after all you're not going to sit there and read a newspaper. The concerns raised on this site about the noise level in the lobby were not an issue. Yes there is "noise" or music playing but we never found it intrusive- actually found the lobby very quiet except in the evening. We got into the bar without having to wait at midnight on a Friday, despite the line, and were seated at a table right away- also no problems with the service. Although the tables all had "reserved" signs on them, ignore this, this proved not to be the case in our experience. The garden was quiet and relaxing when not in use as a bar- perfect for reading the paper early in the morning. While we didn't eat at the cafeteria, they provided free morning coffee which was appreciated. We did not attempt to use the in-room internet service as the library had free internet, which I made good use of. The terrace on the 15th floor was also a beautiful place to sit quietly and have a drink at sunset. The staff were pleasant, efficient and professional. We once had a brief freakout about a drycleaning delivery that had not arrived at the concierge desk but was quickly sorted out as it was being held elsewhere in the hotel. If you are used to living in larger suburban spaces and like staying in chain hotels, then the Hudson probably isn't for you. However we found the hotel to be in a fantastic location, well designed, fun, reasonably priced and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is nothing good about this hotel. The club did get pretty freaky that one night, and the outdoor patio is pretty sweet, but you don't have to stay there to go to the club or the patio. The restaurant food was terrible, despite the unbelievably high price. Stay at the Hilton, and spend an evening in the Hudson lounge if you like.

Reviews.Title: “Hate the Hudson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dark, small rooms, absolutely nothing to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What We Required”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back. We had read the reviews before travelling and did not know what to expect. The Hudson has no sign and so the best way to find it is, as you turn into 58th st from 9th Ave, it is immediately on the right. The doorstaff will be there to meet you. We arrived at reception at 2.00pm and were met with a friendly smile and completed the formalities and we went to our room. It is true what they say about the rooms. There is no storage space especially two people. The room was small but clean and the bed was clean and very comfy. We found the bar prices a little expensive but are not used to the big city. We were stopped once by security at the lifts to make sure that we had a room key. The location was good. a two minute walk to Central park and about 15 minutes to Times Square/Broadway. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful throughout our 4 night stay. We only used the room to sleep as we had so much to see and so the size of room was not a major problem. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms at a Great Big Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There was nothing at the Hudson Hotel that made my latest trip to New York a bad experience, but I doubt that I would ever stay there again. Luckily I took a cab to the hotel because I don't know that I would have found it on my own. I guess not having a sign is super cool, but it makes the hotel a little difficult to find. Luckily at night they have a big yellow light over the door so when you stumble back to the hotel after a few cocktails you can find your way. We were greeted with 'check in is at 3:00, we may have a room available by 4:00.' And while I understand that check in is at 3:00, it is not at all unusual to be allowed to check in early and a "sorry we can't accommodate you right now" would have been nice. We asked for double beds and were told that there would be a $90 surcharge. The room was tiny. No, seriously tiny. We couldn't unpack because there was no dresser or any other place to put clothes. The closet was less than a foot wide so couldn't even store our bags in it. The bathroom was so small that you had to sit sideways on the toilet (and I'm only 5' 6"). I thought the glass wall between the shower and the room was odd but it did make the shower feel less claustrophic. Called for extra towels at 9:30 on Sunday morning. When we checked out at 11:00 on Tuesday, we were still waiting for the towels. The hotel itself was reasonably quiet. Our room faced the courtyard so street noise wasn't too bad for the fourth floor. However, the heater made horrendous noises everytime it came on and shut off. The TV in our room didn't work so we couldn't use express check out. They did offer to send up an engineer to fix it, but honestly I didn't think the two of us plus an engineer would fit in the room. The hallways were scary dark ... painted dark grey and the only light came from a a small yellow light over each door. I'm sure some very famous designer was paid huge bucks to make this hotel look as swanky as possible. And it is visually very interesting, just not all that comfortable for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “It's great in its own way...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I actually really like the Hudson. Other reviewers complain about this hotel for a lot of reasons. Most of those reasons are absolutely true, but it all depends on your attitude. For example: 1. Yes, the rooms are extremely small. But they are stylish, comfortable, and most important, thoughtfully designed. I remember my first time checking into the Hudson, looking into the tiny bathroom, and thinking, "uh oh, this is going to be awful." But I discovered that there are thoughtful little hooks, shelves, and tables aplenty in the rooms and was surprised to find that those touches made all the difference...I've stayed there for weeks at a time on business travel and never felt the least bit crowded. 2. Yes, there is music in the lobby and it is loud in the evenings. The Hudson is very hip and trendy and does have a nightclub feel. However, it is only in the lobby. They must have some excellent soundproofing, as even the rooms on the floor right above the lobby are utterly silent, 24 hours a day. Noise has never been a problem for me when I have stayed at this hotel. 3. Some aspects of the hotel are expensive. The room service food seems very expensive when you look at the menu, but it is the same food that is served at the Hudson Cafeteria, which is an excellent, well-respected restaurant. The food is sublime and costs about as much as you would expect to pay for a higher-end meal in New York. So, again, the complaints are all based on true facts but it depends on your preferences. The things other people complain about don't bother me. What is more important to me is the fact that the rooms are spotless and quiet, the beds are heavenly to sleep in (seriously--more comfortable than my bed at home), the towels are thick and soft, and the service is good. Whether or not you will like this hotel depends on your attitude. If like me you're used to living in a studio apartment in an urban neighborhood, you will probably like this hotel. If you hail from a 3000 square foot suburban McMansion, this hotel will probably be your worst nightmare. It's up to you...take it or leave it.

Reviews.Title: “Hudson - Caveat Emptor!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was cynical of the copious bad reviews I had read about this interesting hotel, so I tried it for one week ( a superior room ?!- well that's the title of the broom closet that I paid for!) Rooms, too small, badly lit, no space for basic clothing and supplies. Service was very poor overall although concierge was great. Some rooms dirty - I had to move twice to get a reasonably clean room. Also, they nickel and dime one to death - say if you feel like having a bottle of wine in your room and therefore you need a wine glass - they charge you $4 for the glass (rental)!!! Still an interesting hotel, but I paid over $390 per night for a very small room and small service, but a big attitude. They didn't deliver. I would advise that you don't ignore the negative reviews as I did - foolishly!

Reviews.Title: “Reviewers are spot on”
Reviews.Author: milepig
Reviews.Content: I agree with others that this is a hard hotel to rate. I'm no longer young or hip (at least by the Hudson definition) but still think that I appreciate quality and understand that it comes in many guises. My problem is that the Hudson is all flash and no substance. From the very beginning things just weren't quite right. There is no outside sign, the doorman must have been used to the confusion since everyone who passed with a suitcase was asked "looking for the Hudon?". The escalators to the main lobby have clearly been reconditioned from the buildings former existence as a YMCA. Very claustrophbic, but with venetian plaster. The problem here was that the plaster was all chipped. My reception was "It's only 1:30, checkin is at 3:00". Not somthing like "I'm sorry, we have no room at this moment". I then sat in the lobby for awhile and watched others (apparently the younger and hipper) being assigned rooms. My inquiry then netted me my cell for the night. My stay in the lobby gave me a chance to observe the cave-like qualities of this space. Full of beautiful people, but one wonders what they look like in the light of day. The hallways on the sleeping floors are indeed dark and narrow - dimly lit and unappealing. My cell didn't give me enough room to turn around in. I've stayed in many small European hotel rooms - this one is unparalled in its lack of space. The room was quite worn - dirty spots on the walls, chipping and peeling plaster around the windor, the white headboard was none too clean. Lots of street noise came in through the window - on the 19th floor! I saw some couples checking in with 4 or 5 bags. I have NO IDEA where they would have put all of it. Upsides? The linens were amazingly wonderful, bathroom amenities great, I loved the window in the shower that added light to the bathroom while also letting me see out. I didn't hear any internal noise - just the noise from the outside. As hard as the lack of space is to disguise from the entry of the room I did think that the designer had done a good job of making the room seem larger that it was once you were inside. Some might have found them tacky, but I really appreciated the wall pegs that let me line everything up for a quick hop into my clothes before my 5:00 a.m. departure. My return to the hotel at about midnight was amazing. I walked in the front door and was hit by a wall of sound. The place was JAMMING! People everywhere, music blaring, etc. Security was present but unobtrusive - no one challenged me on my way to the elevator. Bottom line - for the price there are much better places to stay in NY. Go to the hotel to experience the nightlife, but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “An experience for the young ones and young at heart”
Reviews.Author: lacemonkey
Reviews.Content: I am rather late in posting this review. I stayed for one week with my 77 yr old mother(!) in Sep 03. Ok it was dark, but our room was large (2 very comfortable double beds) and on the same floor as the rooftop terrace. Staff throughout hotel and especially the bars made us feel very welcome although you can imagine we weren't their ideal type of customer. But even they realise that money is money whoever is spending! Concierge was first class. We returned to NY again in Sep 04 and we stayed at Morgans but in hindsight preferred the Hudson. Why am I writing this now ? Well I'm looking for a hotel to take my 21yr old daughter in Feb and - yes, I'm going to book Hudson because she'll just love the bars and the whole ambience and the quirky decor. Bye the way, my mother is quite deaf and hardly noticed the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Lost FedEx Delivery Broken Toilet”
Reviews.Author: VirettaPark
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hudson for eight very expensive nights at the end of September. Business/Leisure trip. I had a very important FedEX business package lost by the staff. The package was signed for but never delivered. This put a HUGE wedge into my business trip. Upon questioning the whereabouts the Manager of Security at the Hudson simply said they lost it and stopped returning my calls! The handle on our toilet broke off the first day and continued to break off everyday for eight days - we had to lift the bowl and stick our hand in to flush it! Complained everyday but it still kept breaking. Ignored our request to change rooms. Gave us $50 off our room for the last day. Seeing as we checked out at 2 am it was HARDLY WORTH IT! We paid the 'Fashion Rate' of $235 per night plus tax etc. The halls were FILTHY, room service OVERPRICED, house music pumping 24hrs OBNOXIOUS. Roof top garden FABULOUS. Thank goodness for the $1.65 bagel and coffee place around the corner. DON'T BOTHER!

Reviews.Title: “different hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is certainly hard to rate this hotel. But after reading the incongruent reviews I feel I must give a sensible and somehow objective review. The Hudson is a modern astounding hotel, tastefully decorated with trendy bars and restaurants which, although mostly visited by the NY young hip crowd, does not make an out-of-towner feel out-of-place. If you want to experience the NY nightlife at its best you can remain in the hotel have plenty of cocktails and look at beautiful people in beautiful surroundings. For a brief moment you will feel that you are part of the hip, rich NY crowd. However, once you leave the common areas and board the elevator, still large and beautiful, you will be sent back to your first year college dorm. When you get off the elevator you are sent into a gray dark maze with hundreds of doors. The doors are so close to each other you will probably wonder if each room has two doors. Well, wrong. The rooms are incredibly small - key work being incredibly. It is 10 x 10 w/ a queen bed and two small tables, one small window overlooking nothing, and a tv the size of a telephone. Trust me, this is by far the smallest room you could have stayed at. There was another review indicating that it was the size of a monk's cell. Well, I have been to a monk's cell and it was larger than the standard room at the Hudson. Now, once you get over the size of the room you realize that it is not so bad, the rooms are clean and nicely decorated, the bed is comfortable and the tiny bathroom has all the amenities. All in all, not so bad. I went w/ my wike for the weekend and had an excellent time. Then again, we were already expecting small - not that much- but we had an idea before arriving. If you want a fun short getaway to NY - this is the place. Don't stay there too long, otherwise you will certainly attempt to tear down a wall to expand your room or start yelling "red rum".

Reviews.Title: “Hassle at the Hudson”
Reviews.Author: 2toucan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in New York which was our first visit there. We chose the Hudson having read some okay reviews on this site. When we arrived and despite booking some months previously they did not have the superior size room available for us as someone had not checked out ! There was no apology and we had to move to the correct room a day later!! This hotel is designed for those who like to operate in the dark... low level lighting everywhere made life impossible. The staff were unhelpful and practically invisible ..no offer to help with luggage etc The rooms are small and ours lacked any shelving . There was only a hanging area!!Designer Shrarger needs to look more carefully at the comfort of guests. Also there was gruesome,loud music playing in the lobby and lift. Food was prohibitively expensive and anyway you couldn't see it because of the lack of light. The only positive comment we can make was the bed and bedlinen which was blissfully comfortable. We are not grumpy old folks and travel around the globe ...be warned take a high level torch with you if you choose the Hudson.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After all of the poor reviews, I had read here, I was reluctant to stay at this hotel. But I Like it a lot: Great Location; Very Fashionable; the Restaurant was great; the Library very confortable. And a Winter Garden amazing! My room was a superior and the size was good.

Reviews.Title: “A masochist's dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you like high prices, dank corridors, the ability to keep dancing to the same music when leaving the bar and continuing into the elevators, 110 decibell music in the lobby, darkness, gloomy little window views of nothing, wretched service, bad attitude and high prices, you'll love the Hudson. This is not a hotel, it's a 20-something nightclub with rooms upstairs. As an expensive hotel for bar pickup and tryst upstairs, it's perfect. As a hotel in any other comprehensible sense, it's incomprehensibly bad. A true wretch of a hotel, this coming from someone who's been in hotels in 35 countries and 20 US cities. I truly know of nothing worse -- anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, Dark and Unbearably uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dreadful! Room smaller than a monk's cell - totally uncomfortable! Bathroom has no ventilation whatsoever and the humidity is unbearable after a shower - no drawers or storage for socks and underwear - must live out of the suitcase and store it in the closet because there is no place for it in the room! Phone is a mile from the "desk" so hooking your computer up is impossible(about a square foot - barely able to fit a laptop on it) virtually no workspace and, worse yet the only chair in the room is a tiny metal, cold torture device - close to 300 dollars a night to top it all off! Truly an outrage.

Reviews.Title: “Cautious traveller”
Reviews.Author: erniec
Reviews.Content: Architecturally exciting and well located BUT standard rooms although spotless and functional are incredibly small, just a foot or three wider than the wonderfully comfortable bed. No room to swing the proverbial cat yet alone cope with 2 suitcases. More expensive rooms are worth the money if there are 2 of you. Can be very noisey. Fluffy white towels are too small and beware the goodies. They are not for free! They charge even for the sewing kit. However it was reasonably priced and we would stay there again. Fabulous bar areas but drinks and food very expensive. Not necessary in this land of plenty!

Reviews.Title: “Great for people watching!”
Reviews.Author: gill61uk
Reviews.Content: Well, I gues you either love the Hudson or you hate it. I loved it! The location is great beside the subway and there is an amazing organic supermarket across the street in the Time Warner Mall. The rooms are small, but how much time are you really going to spend in your room when you are visiting New York? The bed was very comfy and the decor is tasteful. We spent some time out on the roof terrace which was fab and on the whole it was a great place for people watching. My only criticism was the less than regular housekeeping. But we phoned reception and fresh towels were sent up asap.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst service I have ever experienced in a hotel. From check-in (which takes an hour of convincing the receptionist that you have a reservation) to check-out where I was charged for an extra night and $10 for an internet connection (which I didn't make). I am still curious where the computer would be in a room that small.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: beadgirl32
Reviews.Content: After all of the poor reviews I had read here, I was reluctant to stay at this hotel. But since I planned at the last minute, and they offered such a great rate, I couldn't resist. Although this hotel is dark, and the rooms are small - the service I received was excellent. From Samantha who confirmed my reservation to Ann who gave me a tour of the hotel's restaraunts, every staff member that I encountered treated me like royalty. It was fun to sit in the lobby with a book and watch people. Plus, being a guest, I didn't have to wait in line to get a drink at the hip and trendy bar. Yes, the rooms were small - BUT, very clean, comfy bed, plenty of pillows, great heating/air conditioning and other amenities. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible experience! I even called a few weeks prior to my stay to express my concern about the room size upon hearing from a friend that they were small and was assured that the room we had was spacious and would not be a problem! Boy was I mislead!!! THe room is a shoebox! I have never before had this experience nor would I typically complain but this is ridiculous. There is no bureau to keep your clothes in. THe closet is about the size of my linen closet (which is not large). THe bathroom can hardly fit one person never mind a second! The toilet is meant for a toddler at best and I am in no way a big person! It was not a comfortable stay at all. My husband and I were tripping over eachother because there was no room whatsoever. The rooms are also very dark! I called the front desk when I got to my room and was transferred to the Manager. I left a very nice message and no one called me back. I spoke to the night manager upon coming back from dinner and was assured someone would be in touch. That never happened! You couldn't pay me enough money to stay there again and I certainly would never recommend it to anyone! I'm sure the accomodations at the closest Holiday Inn would be better than the one at the Hudson! They ought to be ashamed of themselves! If they had only been honest when I called with my concern, I would have found a more suitable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Alice in Darkness Land”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hudson 10/4/04. As I walked into the room I stopped in surprise, and my husband bumped into me and told me to keep going. I told him I was already in the room! This was the smallest room we had ever been in. It was half the size of my bedroom! I agree with everyone who talked about how dark and dreary the room and hallways were; I was scared to walk in the halls by myself; felt I needed security with me. Hall carpeting had so many stains it wasn't funny. Not only is the room paneled with dark paneling, I spent about 10 minutes pushing on the paneling to see if other storage compartments would open up! The lighting was horrible and the desk lamp didn't work (or I couldn't figure it out). Bathroom lighting is supplied by shower light and a light strip around the mirror (I could barely see myself!). The small tv on my home's kitchen counter was larger than the tv in the room. I could sit on the edge of the bed, stretch my hand out, and touch the tv, it's that close! The only way my husband could watch was propping himself up on pillows behind me on the combination twin/full bed! Even though the bed was very tight (the left side of the bed is flush against the wall, so no arms/legs can hang out), I will say the mattress was comfortable. Fortunately, this was an overnight business trip which our client paid for to the tune of $235/night. We're already looking for alternatives for our next visit; we'll never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Darkness”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
