Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at the Hudson Hotel for the nights of 17-19 September inclusive based on the hotel's website's promises of excellence. I found the hotel's accommodation and services far from excellent and consider the advertisements to be misrepresentative. My main complaints are: A. The reception area is as dark as an underground cavern and unwelcoming. B. Corridors in the Hudson are so poorly lit as it is difficult to determine room numbers. What are they trying to hide? C. The rooms are of garden-shed size with hardly any space to turn. The bathrooms are even more claustrophobic. D. Prices in the restaurant and bars are exhorbitant even for NY. For instance, four gin and tonics cost more than three bottles of gin ($50). My advice? Try and find some other hotel to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hudson”
Reviews.Author: travellinghopefully
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Don't understand the bad reviews. Yes, the rooms are small-tiny- but beautifully set up with everything organized. Service was great, and we ended up upgrading to an amazing room, tons of space. You can't beat the location and the public spaces. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, timy rooms”
Reviews.Author: HotBabel
Reviews.Content: Very chic and hip, indeed, but the standard rooms are 8x8 (not even enough room to fall down in) and there was a very nasty mold in the shower that despite three separate and pointed attempts was never dealt with during my 2-day stay. For masochists only. I have stayed in many hotels, including hip boutiques, but this was among the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Cell Blocks at the Hudson”
Reviews.Author: ArleneDeF
Reviews.Content: Unless you happen to crave the experience of being in a private cell (perhaps you dream of being Martha Stewart), stay far away from the Hudson. As all the previous reviews state, the rooms are unbelievably tiny, miserably dark, and have absolutely no views. Brushing your teeth in the bathroom is a challenge - unless you happen to be under four feet tall. Walking through the long, dark hallways must be very similar to walking through a maximum security prison. However, the guards in a prison are likely far more friendly than the front desk staff at the Hudson. They have big, bad attitude problems. We paid $235 on Oct. 1st for the room, and left after only one night. The only GOOD thing about it was that the bed and down pillows were very comfortable- but not comfortable enough to make up for everything else! Stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “IF”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If... you are comfortable in a bat cave atmosphere, and are not concerned with dark gloomy grungy corridors leading to the rooms, are under 5'6" slender. with no physical disabilities you could fit into the cabin/room and possibly enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels I have ever Stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every bad review on this site is correct. Go there for a drink at 2 am and you will be happy. It is hip, hot, and happening with plenty of good looking night lifers. But for godsakes don't stay there. Not only are all of the other reviewers correct in saying: too dimly lit, TINY rooms (my "suite" was $375 per night and was smaller than my college dorm 15 years ago), loud. But even more importantly, it was FILTHY. The hall carpets were dirty and stained, my room throw rugs were dirty and stained, even the bathroom mirror had stains -- not smears, stains (how do you accomplish that>?). The maid even removed the toilet paper without replacing it... nice to find that out at 2 am. Left after 2 nights. Soho Grand is miles better in this genre -- but we moved a few blocks to the plaza -- real service, real bed, clean, real room.

Reviews.Title: “I've never read such unfair reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a delightful stay at this great hotel and would happily recommend it. It is chic, modern, young, sexy and very well run - but that not might suit everyone's taste. The staff and service were great, the restaurant and bars are excellent and I can't fault it. The rooms are not as large as you might find in another city (and a standard queen size room might not suit a couple who weren't getting on so well) but for New York they are average size, completely clean, very comfortable and well serviced. You can see an accurate floor plan on their website. I really wouldn't get too worried by these other reviews which seem to be about about trivia such as missing bottles of shampoo etc. and perhaps the other reviewer didn't find the main room light which is turned on by pulling the cord on the headboard. You CAN"T stay at the Plaza for the same price and the comment about the doormen is total rubbish - no money changed hands on any of the occasions they got us cabs. I thought it was great fun and I can't understand these negative reviews. Go see for yourselves. I would book again tomorrow with total confidence and really would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hudson by Ian Strangler”
Reviews.Author: Jamie970
Reviews.Content: I sentence you to four nights inprisonment at the low security Hudson prison. You will have no view and not enough room to light a cigarette. The staff will serve rations and be aggresive and you will come out and appreciate every other bad hotel you have stayed at. I stayed at the Hudson on the 28 thru to 31 August and I am still in shock. The decor looks lovely on the website but infact gets to look childish and unprofessional reflected futher in the staff. Stay in a bed at the Soho grand or the floor of Grand central station just not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE. STAY AWAY.”
Reviews.Author: ineedtotravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel , the restaurant, terrace and the bar was all very nice. The bartenders were really rude and did not server you any drinks, even if you waited politly. One of the bartenders was flirting will all the girls and giving them free drinks. REALLY BAD SERVICE. WILL NEVER GO BACK THERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are So DARK”
Reviews.Author: leekimber76
Reviews.Content: I friend of mine and I stayed at this hotel. It was my first trip to NYC, and I was very excited. We paid a lot for these rooms, and I was expecting a quality room for what we paid for. The hallways where very dirty and stained. The room was tiny, and there was no place to put your luggage. The worst was the "art deco" idea of having minimal light. Awful idea! I couldn’t see in the hallways, I could see in my room, I couldn’t even see if I was putting on makeup or not. I think I was blind by the end of trip! Get a few more lights in the room please! One small bedside lamp does not do it! I would never-ever go back there again…. I like a little light to see what I am doing…I couldn’t even tell what color of clothing I was pulling out of luggage! Horrible...Horrible…Horrible….

Reviews.Title: “Schrager likes 'em small”
Reviews.Author: gregjarvis
Reviews.Content: If you like staying in shoeboxes, this is the hotel for you! I have never stayed in a room this small in my life. It was the size of my walk-in closet. The bathroom is quite odd and is actually part of the room itself with a glass barrier. The bathroom is so small that your knees are pressed against the wall when you are seated. On a larger scale the room would actually be appealing, but Schrager obviously wants to treat his guests like sardines. The location is very good, but I realized later that I could have stayed at the Plaza for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: NorwayVikingGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on our honeymoon and wanted to have a special hotel. The hotel reception area, the restaurant, terrace and the bar was all very nice. But the corridors upstairs (where the rooms are) were dark and felt dirty. We were fooled by the room description on their internet pages containing words like spacious, thinking that the room we booked was kind of big. But it was so tiny. We were able to move to a bigger room after two nights (for $100 extra per night) and this room was better. However we forgot a bottle of shampoo and a haircare product in the shower when moving from the small to the bigger room. We contacted housekeeping and asked them to move this to the new room, we never saw it again. It's not really the money 'lost' that bothers us, but the fact that the staff obviously feels that anything forgotten is theirs to keep (either that or they did not find it, which means that they do not clean the bathrooms). Also when we left, one of their doormen got us a cab to go to Newark Ariport. Our driver told us that the doorman had wanted $5 from him to give him the trip. All in all, nice exterior. However rooms are not big and comfortable enogh and service is not good enough for the rates at Hudson

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MarilizOn2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Hudson Hotel August 14-15 for our 6th wedding anniversary. Even though we live 35 minutes away in Long Island and work in the city, we occasionally stay in the city on special occasions or just to be a couple again. The Hudson Hotel was a great place to spend our anniversary. The reason we chose it was because we had reservations at Jean-Georges restaurant (fantastic dinner!!) close by, and we had been to the Hudson bar before and wanted to see the rest of the hotel. We bought the summer promotion which included full American breakfast and slightly larger room (150 sq ft) for $205. I was thinking about the promo which included parking, but I'm glad I didn't get that one since there is a LOT of free street parking everyday after 7PM and all day Sunday. The people at the front desk were very nice to us. I requested an upgrade but since the hotel was fully booked, they were able to give us a corner room (#776) which had more windows. Our room partly faced the inner courtyard, but we couldn't hear any loud music from the bar nor any taxis honking. The room was impeccable and the bathroom was spotless. It was a small room, probably smaller than the typical guest room in someone's house. It helped that we were local and didn't have any luggage, otherwise I could understand some complaints from travelers about where to store belongings. Other reviews comment on the dimness of the hallways. Yes, they are dim but it is part of the overall mood they are trying to impart. My father for instance would complain about it because of his aged eyes. This is a place for a more youthful crowd - it's dark, loud (even the lounge music is played in the elevators at the same decibel level it seems), and sexy. My husband is a chess player, so after breakfast the next morning, we went to relax in the library where there were some game tables (chess, backgammon, and billiards). We probably will stay at the Hudson another time when we're able to avail of another promotional rate - next time requesting a room on the 15th floor closer to the nice rooftop garden. For my out-of-town friends who come to NY for the weekend, this is one of the hotels I will recommend since it is very New York.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel, you can find better in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about staying at the Hudson. My husband and I had heard wonderful things about the hotel, it's bar, ect.. It's anything but what you are expecting. From check in to check out the service was terrible. The room itself is so small we didn't have anywhere to put our clothes, our luggage, and you can't put anything in the bathroom. The hallways leading to your room are stained and look very unclean. We ate at the Hudson Cafe and you might as well help yourself. We sat for 15 minutes before anyone even acknowledged we were waiting to be served. Food was average, nothing special. They leave the doors open to the outside so flies and bugs are flying all around the buffet and fruit. Cleaning service was another thing, they ignore the "please do not disturb" sign, as we had people walk in two days in a row even though the sign was out. The bars were really cool but you can find that anywhere in NY. Supposedly if you are a guest you get better service at the bar but they really don't have any service. It's just a lot of people standing around talking and waiting for you to help yourself. I would never recommend staying at this hotel. You can find a bigger room and much better service somewhere else. Trump Hotel Tower is just around the corner. I really got the feeling they don't care if you stay at the Hotel or not you are just another person and they assume they will be booked whether they are nice or not! LOOK ELSEWHERE

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Trendy”
Reviews.Author: FLMarci
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel rooms are small, but we really enjoyed our stay. It was fun to be somewhere hip and trendy--the bar was really the scene at night. The service was good, our room was very clean and the hotel was beautiful. We really enjoyed the sky terrace on the 15th floor, where you can get room service and drinks. There are lounge chairs for sunbathing too. The location of the hotel was great, very convenient to the subway and many restaurants. Several times we walked to theater district/times square it really wasn't as far as it seems.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: inocentluv
Reviews.Content: So you pay an average of $200 per night for an art deco hotel which is nice to look at but certainly not worth the money. Yes alot of NY hotel rooms are small, but my god this was a closet with cheap furniture. Not recommended for anyone coming for outside of NY, you can certainly find better hotels for your money with bigger rooms and friendlier service

Reviews.Title: “Well I liked it..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in April 2004. I had a queen room which was spacious and worth the extra money. I was also on the 15th floor so the noise problems complained of by other reviewers didn't affect me. The corridors are dark but so what? The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was a decent size considering we were in New York. The restaurant was great but a tad expensive as was the bar. The library room was a relaxing place to spend the day ( which I did as it rained all of my last day there!). I would have no problem staying there again but ideally would choose to stay in Greenwich Village or SoHo as it's a far better location for everything.

Reviews.Title: “A very New York Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having never been to New York or even the USA, I was apprehensive after reading some dire reviews on New York Hotels in general. However what a superb place, super cool and trendy just what I imagined a NY hotel to be. The rooms were very clean but a tad small (which I think is normal for NY) The courtyard was just wonderful, especially when you have come off a long flight, just to sit down have a glass of chardonny and chill. The staff were pleasent enough but they were a bit "up themselves" a bit too cool for words! The overall experience was brilliant and certainly added to the whole New York experience - I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great look, poor service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great looking hotel, right near central park, trendy bar and lovely cherry wood room. However, service was slow (especially the bar), breakfast was very poor (quantity) and the room was a little noisy. Overall, I enjoyed my stay in the Hudson and being near central park was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here if you paid me..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having flown over 24 hours to get to NY from Asia, I was shocked at the lack of service provided from the minute I arrived at the hotel. The front entrance was jammed with people leaving the hotel, and the bellboys were too busy flagging down cabs for them to even notice any new guests arriving, let alone offer a hand. After I dragged my bags up the escalator to the front desk, I was told I could not check into my room early, so after dragging my suitcases down the escalator again to be stored, (and up again second time around when i eventually checked in - where the hell were the bell boys!), i wandered around the streets of NY for 3 hrs, just in time for my jetlag to really start kicking in. From there on in things certainly didnt improve. At 11.05pm that nite when i finally got the urge to have some dinner (or an early lunch where i had just flown in from), I was told by the front desk that room service had just finished, however there were plenty of fast food alternatives within walking distance. I preferred to go to bed hungry. The room was tiny, the bathroom even tinier (hotel bathrooms in tokyo are larger!), there is hanging space but no shelves to place your other clothes (there was one shelf below the tv, however that was used to display Hudson souvenirs for sale, just in case you wanted to take home a reminder of your "memorable" stay there), the corridors were dark and dingy, the breakfast room order menu was only placed in my room on the first nite, and thereafter never to be seen again, and on one particular morning, I left some clothes in the laundry bag on my bed to be cleaned (the form was filled in explaining what was needed to be done), however when i got back that evening and found it to be sitting where I had left it, I was told by housekeeping that I needed to call to let them know it was to be cleaned (did the staff there not have any initiative to look inside the bag?!). Despite asking for a room at the back of the hotel, as suggested by one of the reviews on this site in order to avoid sleepless nites, music came pumping up from the bar till 2am one evening. Which is fine if you dont need to get to work by 730am the next morning... When i finally checked out a week later (still no helpful bellboy around), the doorman asked how my stay was. I told him it had a lot to be desired and explained why I felt that way. He asked for my business card and said he would mention it to the manager and someone would drop me an email. I'm glad I didn't hold my breath waiting for it...

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Disco_Supafly
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel! Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but what do you expect!! This is NYC. If you think this is small, you should see the apartments New Yorkers live in. Actually, the room size was perfect for me and my husband. I loved the down comforter and pillows. I had a hard time getting out of bed in the morning. One thing to remember, if you're into going to bed early, then I suggest when you check-in you request a room that is not located near The Park courtyard bar. This bar starts pumping around 4:30 p.m. and goes on until midnight every night (sometimes later). It's quite noisy and this will definitly carry into your room. Other than the bar, we did not hear people in the rooms above, below or next to us (and there are wooden floors). The famous Hudson Bar is so-so (think "Logan's Run." If you've seen the movie then you'll realize that most of the people staying in the hotel are under the age of 30). As for the bar itself, the drinks are very over priced ($30 for 2 Coronas and one vodka and cranberry). The people who hang out at the bar are 99.9% New Yorkers. You have to see the bar to believe it because most of the people there try so hard to be hip and cool they end up looking ridiculous (some of them were actually posing!!). Aside from the bar, beware of room service. They charge a 15% gratuituy, plus a $3.50 delivery fee, plus a room service charge. So, a $5 pot of coffee ended up costing $12. All in all I still enjoyed this place. The decor and set up of the hotel is very unique and fun. The music played in the elevators was good (house music), though they could do with a decent DJ in the bar (someone from the Ministry of Sound UK would do nicely). I'd definitely stay there again. If you're from Europe, this place is the epitome of everything you hate about Americans. Check it out, it's a riot!!

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Loud, Loud...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hudson Hotel is a nice place, but look elsewhere if you are a light sleeper. My room overlooked a courtyard, and we could hear traffic raging all night. Even on the seventh floor, I could hear and feel the bass from the bar below thumping until about two in the morning. If that doesnt keep you up, then the drunk people running through the halls after the bar closes most certainly will. The walls of the rooms must be made of paper because we could hear our neighbor's doors opening and slamming shut. The room itself was nice and clean, even if were the size of a large shoebox. The cleaning staff must be vigilant, since they invaded my room before 10:00 in the morning while I was in the shower (the shower itself has a transparent wall that looks into the bedrooom--I cool idea, but a bit awkward when the staff lets themselves in). Bottom line is that unless you are getting a great deal or miss your days at the frat house, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It might be the most dimly lit place I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Millenium Hilton for three days and moving over to the Hudson, the experience was less than impressive. While trying to be trendy, they forgot about the room accommodations, which is fine unless you aren't 22 or go clubbing until 5am. The lobby, entrance, and "hotel park" restaurant are beautiful, but look out for the walk to your room! I think the reason they go for a dim (trendy?) look is that the carpets haven't been cleaned since the early '70s.

Reviews.Title: “Ethereal lobby and culinary bliss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really splendid hotel!!! A fairyland oasis in the heart of NY. Up the subway-esque escalators to the most enchanting lobby ever. I travel a lot, all over the world, and this is one of my favorite spots. The rooms are small, but very well appointed. The rooms are not the most user-friendly place for a business traveler, in that the desk is small and the internet connection a little difficult, but those are sacrifices I am willing to make in order to sit with a cup of coffee in the library garden in the morning prior to going out into the hustle of NY business. The food is sublime, and if like me, you are frequently stuck in your hotel room working, room service is everything. Not to mention it is nice to have a unique room so that you do not forget which city you are in this week. There is nothing worse than staying in a tired old chain hotel where you don’t know if you are in NY, Boston, Toronto, or Paris. The staff is gorgeous, but that doesn’t stop them from being friendly and helpful to ordinary people like myself. I a colleague of mine and I met for drinks in the Hudson bar and found the service to be friendly and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came to New York for a surprise birthday weekend. As soon as I arrived at the Hudson I was taken back by the reception area and the funky decor. It was like being in a studio. The rooms are a little small, but I loved the bathroom and the clear wall into the bedroom. The bed linen was so crisp that it looked as if it had been ironed every morning. The only critism was the light in the room I found it impossible to apply any make up in the light. I thought the location was brilliant though, and we went to the outside bar one evening which was very chilled out and great atmosphere. Cocktails were quite expensive ($12 each) but very strong. I would def stay here or recommend my friends to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: west1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hudson from the 9th to 13th of June 2004, after reading some of the reviews, i must say i was a little concerned, small rooms, noisy, poor staff, pretentious!!! Well i can say that all of the above are wrong, we had a great time!!! The bars in hotel are tops!! people watching in the hudson bar is a must.. and the staff were more than helpful. I would and will go back, the place is a real gem, you spot something new on every trip down to the reception, great design.. and yes the room was small, but go with someone your intimate with and what's the problem!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Hudson is a New York experience in itself”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hudson for seven nights with three of my girlfriends. lt was great. I'm sure many critics have commented on the size of the room, but the facilities definitely made up for it. I'm from LA, so I wasn't exactly used to the compacted size of things, but the rooms were extremely clean so I have no complaints at all. The Hudson Bar is reason enough to stay at the Hudson. It's a very hip and happening place, especially during the weekends. Their green apple martinis are fantastic, but overpriced at $12. The Concierge was helpful with helping us find clubs and restaurants to go to and the whole staff was generally very accomodating. The location is nicely situated in Midtown. It's a very safe neighboorhood and blocks from Times Square. Overall, The Hudson made my New York experience a great one. Feel free to email me if you have any questions concerning the hotel! I'd definitely stay at the Hudson again. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel; hated the small size”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Usually staying at a W Hotel but wanting to try something new, I checked out Hudson for 2 nights. This is one amazing hotel! The lobby and bar are straight out of some movie (or a dream). The rooms are neat but very small. I don't think that I would have enjoyed it as much if I neede to stay in my room for any length of time - it felt like the walls were closing in towards the end of my stay. The staff was beatifull and helpfull and it was fun to people watch going to / coming from my room. The hallway carpet needs some serious cleaning. I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy? Under 35? It's THE place to be”
Reviews.Author: supershearer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hudson from 17 June for 4 nights and were a little worried after reading the reviews on this site. We booked thru Octopus travel and paid less than £100 a night, what a bargain! The hotel is in an excellent location, Central Park just down the block along with a Subway station with links to all the shopping and entertainment that NYC has to offer. The staff were beautiful, helpful and offred us advise on where to go and how to get there. Both the Hudson and Library bars, and the lobby on a Friday and Saturday night were bustling and full of people, what do you want? A dead bar with no action? Try another hotel. This place ain't for you! The rooms we saw were small. This is New York, rooms are small, and if you're sad enough to want to stay in your room then again this ain't the hotel for you. In the small room there is a CD player, TV with cable, a small bathroom with a good shower and a few soaps and shower gels. If you need somewhere that's a base to grab a few hours sleep and is a bit different from a boring Marriott or Hilton then this place is for you. Not for the business traveller, maybe not for the oldies, but people who want more than a faceless huge hotel look no further than The Hudson.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & Unusual. Read on.........?.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hudson for the second part of our Honeymoon. Brilliantly placed for Central Park, Lincoln Centre and Mid Town. The new Time Warner complex is almost directly across the road which has a new Mall incorporating a Whole Foods Market and the fantastic 'V' Steakhouse. The Entrance is striking and definately out of the ordinary. Certainly not breathtaking, but certainly different. When you enter the hotel you are presented with an escalator to the lobby that basks you in lime green light from the perspex walls. By the time you reach the top you have been transported to a place that exudes difference! The whole joint is alive with people milling around soaking up the energy. Behind the lobby is the 'Park' Its an oasis of serene greenery and comfy seating that doesn't try to be anything more than a great place to relax, supp on a decent drink and mingle with the 'friday' crowd. The waitresses were impeccably dressed with evocative but stylish attire that aided the desire to order more drinks from them! The library bar takes you to another feeling. Its grandly laced in strong veneers and woods, the pool table sits perfectly and the whole bar has a modern gent feel to it. Modern day Michael Caines would feel at home in here, creasing into one of the large aged leather sofas. The grill, didn't play, sorry, eat in there, so I can't comment. This is New York, can you lose anyway? The main bar has a perspex lit floor, fresco ceiling, eclectic resting places, attentive, experienced and confident bar staff and pretty good dj's on a weekend. We hit the bar on the saturday evening on the way back from the Saigon Grill and there is barely room to dance once the place gets fired up! If getting down to the Sugar Hill Gang at 2.A.M. with your lady is your bag then here's where you need to be! We left for our room at 3 and it was still rocking! Sky Terrace. Nice! Especially at dusk when the city cools down a bit. Drinks are available at room service rates. Yeh, I know, take one up from the bar! Gripes? Just a couple. We wanted to extend our stay by a couple of extra nights. Kept being passed from pillar to post for what seemed like an age. The communication between Reservations, Front Desk and Concierge needs sorting! The air conditioning has the reluctance of a child joining a new school on its first day! Once again, needs sorting! So, if you're still reading this then i've succeeded in regurgitating how I felt about the place and hopefully you've gained some well deserved info. To summarise, Great Feel, Prententious? a bit but who cares because the Pretentious people don't give a sh*t about anyone but themselves anyway! Good staff, functional rooms, great communals. Come on then........What more do you need when the greatest collection of mankinds efforts is on you doorstep! Yep, the rooms are small but this is New York and this not a particulary expensive hotel AND you get the communal facilities that exceed most hotels in the city. All I can say is......You weigh it up big shot!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Raym_London
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Hudson and loved it. This is a smart & trendy hotel. Most people are youngish (25-40) and well dressed. This is a lively hotel with dance music in the lifts and maybe wouldn't suit elderly people but who knows, we spoke to a middle aged lady who liked it also, and her husband stays there regularly on business. Although the rooms are on the smallish side, they are big enough, nicely decorated and comfortable. If you’re going to New York you're probably not going to stay in your room much anyway!! This is a great hotel and I for one would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Hudson if you want to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bottom line - I could not sleep b/c of the clanging plumming that started at 3 am and continued the rest of the night. And I wore ear plugs! I complained about it after the first night and got no response. No point staying at a hotel where you can't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service -”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hudson in the middle of May. I had three incidences that were unacceptable. First, when I drove up I did not notice any parking available. I drove up to the bellhop and said "hi, I'm checking in" and he said "this is the Hudson." Obviously I knew it was the Hotel since it is the only one on the block. I guess he thought that because I am an African-American female I could not possibly be staying there. Later, my friend and I were going into the elevator (mind you, we were dressed in classy cosmopolitan attire), and another bellhop was holding the elevator, completely glanced over us and asked an older gentleman if he was going up. Lastly, we went to the bar/lounge and waited for a while looking to see where we could sit since we didn't know if the lounge area was reserved. Low and behold, a waiter approached a party of 4 who came after us and asked if they wanted a seat. Even after we were finally seated our rude waitress did not get friendly until I had her charge the drinks to our room. Bad experience...small rooms.... would NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels not as good as the website says”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and tried not to let them put me off. This was sold to my partner and I as a 4* hotel, what a load of rubbish. I agree the style of the hotel is gorgeous and well designed but in a rather small lobby. The roof terrace and garden bar is nice too but very expensive with alot of pretentious people coming in and out, making you feel like you should have dreesed up just to go shopping! (not relaxing atmosphere at all) plus my boyfriend said he saw prostitutes outside the hotel asking men if they could come into the bar, and they did! The room was very small. You could just about walk round the outside of the bed, and once you got some shopping, there was no where to put it. Also no where to put underwear, so had to leave some clothes in my suitcase. We did not get much in the way of toiletries either, everything else you normally get for free in a 4*hotel you had to pay for if you used it, like the minibar. The bed was comfy and the view was superb but thats what you would expect. I would not stay here again. After a long flight and alot of walking round, you do not want to come back to a tiny room. Its too claustrophobic and yes we were out most of the time but it still was an irritation to keep walking into each other in the room or stand on the bed just to look in the mirror !

Reviews.Title: “One-Star Hotel with Five-Star Attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice "hip" concept but poorly executed. Surly, unhelpful and generally poorly trained staff; they act as if they are doing YOU a favor by allowing you to stay there. They seem to have forgotton that they are in the HOSPITALITY industry. In a city flush with fine hotels, providing skilled, respectful and attentive service, this will remain a bottom of the list choice for future stays. I'll be surprised if its still there in a year.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are too small!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from New York, I hadn't been there is 6 years and decided to go for a "cooler" hotel this time. It is fairly trendy, especially the outside bar behind reception, however anyone can go in. Why pay to sleep in such a small room. The bathroom is just the icing on the cake! As someone else mentioned before if you want luxury and space book elsewhere and just come to the Hudson for a drink to watch people and be seen. The location is perfect but there are plenty of other hotels in the area which I am sure will have larger rooms. It was a dissapointement but NYC is still the best city in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy plumbing and coach loads of students”
Reviews.Author: Honoria1
Reviews.Content: I think it is a coverted hostel (?) and the original plumbing seems to be intact. the noise at night was dreadful..rattling aircon, clanging pipes and coach loads of medical students returning troughout the night. The room service (ie please help us open our window) is non existent. We saw 2 rooms as the first didn't have a bath so we saw 2 very dusty rooms and they both smelt. We did complain at the time and afterwards and have been offered ONE free night's stay but honestly..just don't go there. Location is good but there is no trademark Sanderson "feel good" quality and you pay alot for a tiny dark room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC, but small rooms, young crowd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC about 8 times a year for business and have tried a variety of hotels in the Central Park/Midtown area. If price is a key consideration, this hotel is a real winner. If efficiency of the room design, being able to work in one's room, or wanting to share one of their standard rooms with another person -- this is definitely not the hotel to choose. The rooms are small. Very small. Think small and then half the size. A double bed barely fits into the standard room. Having said that the bed and sheets are quite nice if you are into that sort of thing. The room is also not set up to get any work done if you are a business traveller. There are not enough plug-in areas, the "desk" is not big enough to work on and the lighting is terrible. I arrived at the hotel about 10:30 p.m. after travelling from a couple of other cities on the US on business. The lobby lights are incredibly dim and all of these fabulous looking twenty something New Yorkers were crowding the lobby and the bar area. My heart sank. I thought: "I am way too old for this." (I am 36). After I checked in, which was fairly efficient, I went to get settled in my room. Walking through the hallways to get to my room, I was getting increasingly anxious. The halls looks like dormitories with a funky lighting problem. I took a deep breath and told myself I could also check into another hotel the following day if I really couldn't stand it. When I entered the room I was shocked at the small size, but pleasantly surprised at the comfort of the room given its diminutive nature. The room was very clean and well kept. New and modern looking design. While I wouldn't stay here again on business -- too far away to walk from midtown, rooms not conducive to working -- I would highly recommend to someone travelling to NYC on their own for leisure travelling. DO NOT, however, share a room of this size with anyone, if you like your space. You will be falling all over each other and it won't be pretty.

Reviews.Title: “over 40? read this!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hudson recently and would not return. Not because it was terrible- it wasn't. It's that while it had some wonderful qualities, it lacked some essential amenities. The good- location, interior design, staff, HVAC, and a reasonable value. I did not sample the nightlife, but the bar looked like fun. My room had two full size beds, so it never felt claustrophobic. The bad- if you've hit the age where you need glasses, it is not a good hotel choice. The lobby, corridors, bedrooms, closets, bathroom- all VERY DARK. It's a "look", I know, and a great one at that, but I couldn't see. Forget applying makeup. And no drawers. There's a small shelving unit, but I don't like my lingerie on display each time I open the door for room service. And the Cafeteria was very pricey for overcooked Eggs Benedict. So although it's a fun place that does many things well, it doesn't score highly in some categories that are non-negotiable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: CMDS
Reviews.Content: Not sure where all the complaints come from about the service. We had excellent service from everyone. Yes the rooms are small, but very modern and clean. The terrace on the 15th floor is a great place to sit back and relax while drinks are brought to you after roaming around the city earlier in the day. It is close to Central Park and the nightlife at the hotel is great. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: BrookerA
Reviews.Content: The Hudson is undoubtably the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. I would not stay there again even if it were free! I have been to New York, NY a couple of times, and I know that the room are generally smaller than rooms in other cities (I travel a fair bit), but this place was laughable. I guess being trendy means being terrribly uncomfortable. There really is only about one foot around the double bed - which is really a futon, and the bathroom is so small my knees touched the wall when I was on the loo (I'm only 5'5"). The closet is so small the suitcase doesn't fit, so you have to leave it the small hallway by the bathroom. The bathroom has a glass shower that looks to the "bedroom". If you're travelling with someone who's an exhibitionist and you're a voyeur, it's fine - otherwise it's ridiculous. The lighting is bad, it is so dark. There are not enough plug-ins, if you're female (or male, whatever) and you like to do your hair and make-up, forget it - there is no place to put your stuff. I'm certain there was some kind of mold, because I got terribly congested - moved hotels after one night, no congestion... The very dark exterior hallways aren't dark enough to hide the stains on the carpets. The staff was snotty and very ineffiecient. The restuarant "The Cafeteria" was expensive for what you got and the service was terrible. It also has long tables like a cafeteria and benches. Sorry, but if I'm spending $30 on an entre I want a proper chair and I don't want to sit with strangers. One night was more than I could take, so I moved over to The Marriot - same price, real bed, real bathroom, clean, great staff.........need I say more!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for NYC, unless you NEED a ton of room. Room size in NYC, in the sub-250 range, in desirable areas, will always be smaller than anywhere else in the country. But if you expect it, accept it, everything else about the Hudson is primo. It is located just off Central Park, and next to major subway stops. The staff was great. The bar - if you're into that kind of thing - was hopping until 4 AM. And the room - although small - had a good sized bathroom, was spotless, very stylish, and comfortable. Sure, the TV was a 12 or 13 incher, but who cares? If you want a room as big as a "standard" hotel room in any other city, go ahead and stay somwhere else - and I guarantee you will spend 3 or 4 times what you would at the Hudson, or you'll be staying in a less desirable area. When we come back to NYC, we will definitely try to stay at the Hudson again.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were a bit apprehensive but decided to stick with the Hudson. Thank goodness we did!! Beautiful, ultra modern and friendly. This was my first trip to NYC and the city nor the hotel didn't disappoint. When we first went up to our room we were actually scared to open the door, as we expected a matchbox sized room. My boyfriend is 6.4" and we had booked a standard room with a double bed, we were so pleasantly surprised. There was ample space and no tiny toilet like we had expected. We were on the 17th floor so didn't experience any of the noise. Our TV screen was bigger than the one we have at home! I am definitely coming back to NYC and definitely coming back to the Hudson.

Reviews.Title: “Hudson Hotel - who's complaining?”
Reviews.Author: kathyj123
Reviews.Content: Of all the tiny hotel rooms I've stayed in in NYC, this is by far the best of the bunch. Everything was laid out extraodinarily well and they didn't try to fit a bunch of huge furniture into a small room. To all those who have complained about the size of the rooms: Duh! It's New York. While I would probably upgrade rooms if it was more than just me staying there, it was fine. The service was beyond excellent. Everything from bars to food was expensive but good (and unique: truffled mac and cheese?). But a warning to 30-something's like myself: If you can't handle ultra-hip and 20-something's make you feel old, stay at one of Leona's places.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: napili00
Reviews.Content: I am much more in agreement with the three most recent reviews! As a traveler on a budget, I was shocked at the rates I was quoted in NYC for four nights over Easter weekend! I wanted to be in walking distance of the theater district. Finally, out of frustration, I tried Priceline.com and landed the Hudson for only $110 per night!! At this rate who cares about small rooms! The hotel's public areas and staff were supurb. My advise is if you can't get a room here for under $200, then look elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel before reading the comments on this site and admit to being very nervous about my choice. I've stayed at other Ian Schrager hotels and loved them so it was hard to believe that the Hudson wouldn't offer the same quality as the Clift or Mondrian. My best friend and I stayed over the weekend of April 2nd and LOVED it!!!! By the end of our stay she said that whenever possible, she would only stay at an Ian Schrager hotel. The bad: our phones did not work, we blew a fuse in the room, one of our windows was off the track and almost fell 6 stories when I tried to open it. The good: less than 10 minutes after reporting the phones and the fuse, an engineer was at our door to fix them. The beds and pillows were so comfortable that it made it hard to get up in the mornings. The room was not the most spacious but they have done a wonderful job making it feel roomier than it actually was. It felt like a retreat away from the rest of the world; a great place to relax and unwind. All around the service was great but I have to say that the doorman went above and beyond. If you are looking for a Four Seasons kind of stay, this isn't the place for you. This place is full of life and activity and the decor is fun, fun, fun!!! I truly enjoyed the hotel and would not only stay again, but will recommend it to any friends planning a trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the bad reviews??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Why do people complain so much, Common complaints 1) rooms are small- Well yea they are small but WELCOME TO NEW YORK, altough the standard rooms here are the smallest that Ive stayed in they arent much smaller than the others. Anyways who goes to New York to sit in their rooms, try going out see the city get something to eat, it really can be fun. People who comlain forget to comment on how clean the bathrooms are, and the comfort of the beds 2) Service was bad- I had no problem with the service at all actually they were great and very helpful. People just need patience if something dosnt come in 5 minutes they freak out. and if its room service that caused the problem why are you eating room service when there are so many nice little restraunts in the area. 3) Dark hallways- come on this is the stupidest complaint. who cares if the halls are dark, they werent that dark that i couldnt see where i was. This comment shows that people need something to complain about. I had no trouble with any of the things that they encountered, but i ve stayed here more that once and am planning on staying here again. And heres a message for eveyone the hudson isnt as bad as everyone says.

Reviews.Title: “A chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hudson on business in March 2004 and I had a great time. The bar is very chic and the rooms, while tiny, are very nice and very clean. The staff was very helpful. If I have a complaint, it is that when I had to iron my shirt, I had some trouble finding space to iron in. The rooms are pretty tiny! All in all, this is a great, clean, chic hotel for the price (we paid $150).

Reviews.Title: “Dont worry its fine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hudson. I too had booked before reading these reviews, and was worried I had made a big mistake. The hotel was great and we had no problems. The staff were friendly and helpful, paticularly the concierge who tried his hardest to get my boyfriend baseball tickets at Madison square garden at a reasonable price. The rooms are small but perfectly fine. The minimal design makes the most of the space, and the two large mirrors placed opposite each other give the illusion of much more space. The bed is incredibly comfortable. The bathroom is small and you will either love or hate the glass wall that seperates the shower from the bedroom. I really liked it and amused myself for the whole 5 days writing messages to my boyfriend on the steamed up glass. We had no problems with noise. The air conditioning is not the quietest I have ever heard but would not stop you sleeping unless you are a quiet sleeper. Good little telly and a great CD player. The hallway carpets do need some attention, so Hudson I would suggest its time for some refurbishment. The security was good and our hotel keys were checked at the lift to make sure we were guests. I was impressed that the security guard recognised us after a short time and always greeted us. The public areas are amazing and the bar is good. We had a very warm weekend and the garden bar was lovely. Dont think the hotel is just for the early 20's. Im in my thirties and I loved it. I also saw a lot of mixed ages. There seemed to be a few family groups there and on more than one occasion I saw people of 60+ enjoying cocktails in the bar. Dont be put off. This hotel is about design and the rooms are small but its a vibrant and fun place to stay with a comfortable bed. The location is good and I look forward to staying there again. It has character and I liked that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ever Sat At The Hudson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are VERY small, just one foot around the bed. Bathrooms have a 24 inch pocket door entry...your knees will touch the wall when you use the cammode. Dark hallways. Very poor entrance. Not good even at a low price!

Reviews.Title: “No, really ... don't stay at the Hudson”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: No, really. Don't stay at the Hudson. We stayed at the Hudson the first weekend of March, 2004. We've stayed at the other Ian Schrager hotels and loved them (Paramount, Morgans, St. Martens Lane). But there is truth to the other reviews. We did not get the under $100 rate. We did ask for an extra large room when making our reservation (we traveled with child). They put us in a very small room. It's true, the carpets in the hallway are gross. The halls reek of smoke (and I am an occassional smoker). I think I summed it up best when after numerous complaints to the front desk, I finally said "Look, this place is like a huge frat house." It is. I overlooked the noisy lobby - it was fun. I overlooked the small bathrooms - they were clean. But if you do have a problem insist on speaking to a manager face to face. It was the only they made a little effort to assistant in serving us. They did admit it is their largest hotel (1000 rooms) and it is the hardest to service. Please consider these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry! It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Relax, it's NOWHERE near as bad as these reviews would have you believe. Remember that the only people who write reviews on these sites are those who have an axe to grind. I'm adding mine as a way of redressing the balance as I was SO nervous before we came. I actually made the mistake of booking the Hudson before I had read the reviews - and my heart sank when I did (both here and on hotel.com) - possibly the worst reviews I have ever seen about a hotel. It almost ruined the trip; I was expecting Naomi Campbell vomiting in the pot plants and Kate Moss weeping hysterically in our doorway, but we found the whole experience rather genteel and elegant (in a modern, minimalist way of course). We went over a weekend and there was never the sense that it was party central, we slept well despite the bar being crowded (it's fantastic for Sex and the City-type people watching, but defintely not intimidating - and the cocktails cheap for NYC). Even the staff were courteous and efficient (despite being annoyingly good looking). That said, all of the complaints on this site have an element of truth. There WAS clanking plumbing (once a night for a few minutes), the doors DO slam (not enough to wake you) and the corridors ARE dark and in need of a little TLC. But I would genuinely say that was balanced by the cool decor and atmosphere (yes, it is cool, but that's not a bad thing and that's why you come here isn't it?), it has a great location right by the park AND it's cheap for a quality Manhatten hotel (we got it for under $100 each). If you're worried, I'd say ask for a room higher up the hotel away from the bar and/or upgrade which gives you plenty of space. Finally, I'd like to take issue with my fellow reviewers who say it's your fault for being so square - when you're in New York, of course you should get out and live it, but it IS important to come back to a nice hotel room to relax and recharge for the next adventure. I'd say that the Hudson is a fine place to do that. We had a great time both in and out of the hotel and would fully recommend it if you can get it cheap (otherwise why not stay at the Mandarin Oriental round the corner, that gets universally great reviews!). Honestly, it's a nice hotel! Really!

Reviews.Title: “A bid youth Hostel !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LUFO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nothing more than a very very very big youth hostel !!!!!!!!!!!!!! It has over 1000 rooms ! The staff is not able to serve all theese people !! What you get is a stylish youth hostel which is nothing more as a big cash-cow !! I think there are soo many places to stay in new york go there !! BUT go to the hudson an take a drink at the bar....

Reviews.Title: “Twilight Zone in a Cave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the horrible reviews you've read are true! While my husband and I are attracted to modern hotels, decor, furniture, etc., these things will not make up for this hotel. The room is literally a closet, the bathtub isn't even full size. Size aside, what the hotel fails to tell you is that when they bought the building, a former condo building, not all of the tenants were ready to leave ... in fact, some of them are still there! You will find this out yourself if you take a stroll on the 18th or 20th floor. I came upon this by accident, looking for a working vending machine. When you arrive on these floors, you feel like you're in the twilight zone. Completely unrenovated and spooky -- felt like Norman Bate's hotel! What else can i tell you? There are ice machines, but no ice buckets. Don't expect anything plush for the $200+ dollars you will spend - AC barely cools, no ploofy robes, no conditioner, just shampoo plus, no fridge, etc. etc. Definitely not worth your money. If you want a nice hotel w/ similar decor, try the W.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked us into the Hudson - reading the reviews I was trying to get him to change his mind but I'm so glad we didn't. The staff were extremely friendly - from the moment we stepped out of the car to when we left. Victoria who was our meet & great was informative and considering the amount of people passing through was chatty when we next saw her. The bar is fab, as is the buffet breakfast - we got a deal including breakfast and a cocktail each in the bar - so $223.57 ea for 2 nites (incl all taxes) was certainly not cheap but not hugely overboard either. The rooms are really nicely done and when we had a problem with the iron (I dropped it ...opps) it was replaced immediately. The beds are fab, as is the linen but bring your credit card if you want to use the mini bar (or leave officially with the Philip Starck Chair) The rooftop garden wasn't officially opened but we had a look around & it's fab. We took a peek at the 18th floor (not belonging to the hotel) which is a bit spooky but not as spooky as getting in the one elevator which only serves the floors not part of the Hudson - so you zoom from 18 to Ground..quite odd when faced with older residents! Otherwise, really great place & time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: livvylou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hudson hotel late last year, for a girly shopping break. We chose the hotel for its trendy bar, and funky pictures on the website. We made a mistake. The check in was slow, they almost couldn't be bothered. The room was very dark, hardly any lights, and there wasn't anywhere appropriate to place your small clothing items. The bathrooms were small and minimalist. OK, this is a minimalist hotel, and minimalist is definitely what you get in the rooms. The public areas are beautifully designed, the bar and restaurant are very nice, but anyone can use these. Spend your money on a nicer hotel room (they aren't cheap) elsewhere, and get a taxi to the hotel if its the bar you want. By the way, a room service cappuchino is around $8 !! Fine if you're on expenses.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the hudson and it was just great. friendly and helpfull staff clean rooms (yes really really small though) very nice bars (both of them) (bit expensive but you get what you pay for - a nice place, bit of posh, and very good cosmos) The location is brilliant, specilly if you like to run in the mornings (close to central park) definitely will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for a younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hudson when we arrived, as we could not get accomodation at The Alex for the full duration of our visit. We thought we had come into a club rather than the hotel! Smart, funky and full of New York's beautiful people, the Hudson was a perfect first night for us. Our room was not small, despite other reviewers comments. We did have to wait awhile to be checked in as there was only one person at the desk (it was midnight, but still busy), and our room did seem quite noisy from traffic even though we were on the 12th floor. Definately worth a night-a visit to the bar is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Success of the Hudson relies on the Bar alone.”
Reviews.Author: PeaTunbridgeWells
Reviews.Content: The Hudson Bar is the coolest hippest bar we have been too. The lobby is uber-chic and the Library and Restaurant are impressive. However the Hotel relies too much on these successes and fails in many other respects. Rooms are frighteningly small (Believe us, we are English, so are used to small rooms, but these induced claustrophobia, if you are English, think, "Caravan bedrooms") Only when we upgraded 2 levels did we get a good sized room. The Air conditioning systems needs replacing. It is the noisiest thing ever. You will have to be inebriated if you expect any sleep. Also the walls are thin and so you can hear much noise from corridors and door slamming from adjoining rooms. It is such a pity that the Hudson did not use the space to create less rooms, with better comfort. location is OK and as a guest its great to skip to the front of the bar queue in manner of VIP ! However, my suggestion would be stay elsewhere and get to the bar early to enjoy the trendy and uber-chic drinking hole for which the Hudson is famous.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel the first thing that you notice is that this hotel is for the trendy young ones, the business traveler and is very dark. However the reseptionist (Mark) was very helpful because our tour operator had told us we were booked in at the Hudson and we were not. After handing over my credit card then we were allowed to stay 3 of us in 3 rooms! We were told that we would have to sort the problem ourselves the next morning. After sleeping in the weirdest room I've ever slept in I went down stairs to find that Mark had gone off shift and the receptionists we then delt with did not want to know and were not helpful at all. After asking them on many occations to help us call our tour operator in England they still would not help us. When we did finally reach home we were told to wait in reception for a call back. This took a further hour because the receptionist said we were not there when they did, even though we were stood in front of her! We just got the feeling that now they had our credit card number they didn't care. However, the nicest people we met at this hotel where the people on the doors and the ones who carry your cases. In the end they were the ones who helped us call England! So for their kindness only I give this hotel 3 * and not for any other reason. If you are planning a trip to NY please don't stay here your trip won't be as great as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “It was lovely”
Reviews.Author: gonker
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hudson from 5th to 8th March, 2004 and it was fine. I was a bit aprehensive after reading the reviews but I had no problems. The check in staff were professional and friendly. The rooms were TINY but clean no chipped paint and the bed was really comfortable. It is a great location near subway station and within walking distance of all the sights. I had no noise in my room ( i was on the 19th floor) and had a lovely view. Took us a while to find the lights which are disguised as pictures at the side of the bed and a tassle at the back of the headboard of the bed. Television was small but for the size of room perfect it pulled out from the press so was fine. Overall really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Run away! Run away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 3 other hotels in New York, and numerous ones across the country, and this was without a doubt the worst. And that includes the filthy Motel 6 in Kansas City 20 years ago. The Hudson is dark, dingy and so tiny the only place to get dressed is in the hallway. Women over 5'7" cannot sit on the toilet. The vessel sinks don't leave any room for your toothbrush. The shower has a glass wall into the bedroom - apparently an attempt to make the room look larger. That also means you deal with not one, but two, shower curtains attacking you while you shower. The television that is in the room is about a 13 inch tv that is stuck into a cabinet on the side of a wall. The room had an amazingly coffin-like feel, between a queen sized platform bed that fills (and I do mean fills) the bedroom, wood walls, and white gauze curtains. Anyone who thinks being treated like a transient in an SRO is an upscale, trendy, hip and totally New York experience, needs some major therapy. Want New York? Go to the Park Central. Clean, decent size, same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, almost dingy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went there a couple of months ago. If you want the nice, clean, swiss hospitality and efficiency, evening turn-down type of place then its not for you. The rooms are small, the walls are chipped and marked, shower rails and towel racks are about to come off the walls, you may have a ceiling about to cave in, surfaces haven't been properly dusted, the aircon/ heating is noisy and the location is not the best. The carpets and walls of the corridors are grotty like the worst highway motels, there was even the classic room number hanging upside down. Staff was pleasant enough, but a bit young and inexperienced. The bars were ok but hardly the mind-blowingly amazing experiences that some of the reviewers seem to think. Its expensive, pervasively dark, the rooms have a strange cold ambiance and if all of the above makes it sound like too much of a bother just to be hip then you're probably better off going to the type of hotel your parent's might have taken you to as a kid. I'm not going back, even though I got a great upgrade - really its a hotel where you should inspect the room before you decide to stay there, great variation in quality was evident.

Reviews.Title: “Style matters”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in the Hudson, including a weekend. There were things I liked and things that I didnt. Over all im happy to recommend it, though, especially if you get a deal on the room. Pros: No. 1 decor and ambience. This was the overriding factor in my view. Paul S. picked up here where he left off at the royalton and paramount. Trendy chic ultra-modern. The lobby, library and main bar are amazing. A lot of the hotel is dark wood with brick in the lobby, but the bar is a riot of color, with an illuminated floor. The entire package makes u feel that staying there is an experience, not like marking time in the generic, dated, boring hyatts, sheratons and marriotts. The people who hang out there are amazing, btw, its all you woud exect from a hip NY hangout. No. 2 location. Its great, near the park, near the theaters etc No. 3 staff. Unobtrusive, helpful. Even the cleaning staff, who respected my privacy the whole time. No. 4 At short notice, I got approx 160 a night, which was about 30% less than the I was getting quoted for the royalton, paramount or either of the "W" hotels, that deliver the same kind of ultra modern "hotel product". ConsNo.1 THe room really was tiny. Laughable, really. I was travelling solo, so It was ok, and the amenities were fine. Had an iron and board, CD player, safe etc. However, 2 people would be really struggling, although in NYC, why spend time in a hotel room doing anything but sleeping. No.2 food and drink in the hotel were really expensive. the $12 G+T at the bar just isn't right. No. 3 NOISE. that was bad. If it wasn't for the $12 G+Ts I wouldnt have slept! I thought that the window was open, the street noise was so loud. And I heard noise from neighboring rooms at times, but it wasnt terrible.No. 4 not enough plug sockets in the room. No. 5 There was an exercise room, but I would have prefered a far better health club. They say that the exercise room is only temporary, though, and maybe the concierge get get you into a nearby health club. Overall I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February 04 after my original hotel cancelled my booking. My original hotel was much cheaper than Hudson so I got a really great deal for a really great hotel. This hotel is in a fantastic location (right next to Columbia subway station, over the road from Central Park and within walking distance of Time Square). The staff were very friendly although the room service staff were a little too keen to come into my room to tidy up (they ignored my "Do not disturb" sign on several occaisions). The decor of the hotel is a sight to behold, the bar and library are fantastic. My room was small but that wasnt an issue as I was travelling alone. There is a place for everything in your room so you do not feel boxed in. The only issue I had was the noise.. this place is LOUD, really LOUD! In fact I don't think I had one full night sleep the whole time I was there but I think that is more of a problem with NYC than it is with the hotel. I will stay here again, purely for the location and the attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, not so excellent room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hudson during Valentine's Day weekend to celebrate our anniversary. My husband spoke to the concierge, who was an absolute lifesaver, several times prior to our visit to secure dinner reservations and Broadway tickets. The concierge, upon discovering that it was our anniversary, upgraded our room to an executive suite at no extra cost. We arrived 3 hours prior to check-in and were greeted at the desk by very friendly and helpful staff. They suggested a near-by restaurant where we could eat and wait for our room to be cleaned. At this point, we were certain that our hotel selection was a perfect choice. And, if this were the only criteria for judging a hotel, by all means I would recommend the Hudson. However, the guest quarters are not as worthy of praise. The hallway carpets were filthy and our room had a very strong smell (we concluded it was the aromatherapy that is available in the minibar for purchase.) After the bar opens at 4pm the noise level is pretty high, so a restful sleep is completely out of the question. I could actually hear the bass from the sound system thumping as I laid in bed at 2am trying to sleep. The food in the restaurant is fair, but the prices are too high for the quality that was served. Same goes for the Hudson Bar. The library bar is probably the highlight of the property, but come early if you expect to snag a seat anywhere other than the hallway or lobby. Although we thoroughly enjoyed our New York get-away, we will not be visiting the Hudson in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just for the bar and the library”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel for two main reasons: the bar and the library - even though I have to mention that I stayed in this hotel during winter. In summer I can imagine the roof-terrace to be a very nice place to hang out... apart from that: rooms are incredibly small, the fittings seem pretty improvized, food&drinks are outragousely expensive,... All in all - not quite worth the money... even though people seem to love it...

Reviews.Title: “small, trendy, good location for Central Park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good experience...rooms are about 10x10....got it for about $130/night which made it worth it. Great spot for getting to Central Park on foot. Real short cab ride to theaters and Times Square. Hotel employees courteous. Recommended if you can get it for $180/night or less.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hip Hooray”
Reviews.Author: genevieve1976
Reviews.Content: The Hudson is not made families or old fuddy duddys. If you in NYC on a shopping jaunt or into the nightlife, you have found your niche. Me and my girlfriend stayed there over an extended weekend this past July 2003 and enjoyed ourselves tremendously. From the stunning lobby to the attentive staff (a bellboy even flagged us down a street corner in the East Village to say hi!) The Hudson does not abide to supersizing, choosing to offer their guests small stylish quarters and a beautiful setting. The Hotel is targeted at budget challenged Hipsters who see no shame in looking their best and great pleasure in recognizing their own!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Scared Off...”
Reviews.Author: christianneanastasia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hudson, in spite of all the negative reviews I'd read on Trip Advisor. After finding a great promotional rate through the hotel's own website--the rate included overnight parking, which is usually an outrageous $50!--I booked a standard room. The hotel's lobby is beautiful, as are most of its common areas, and the rooms, though small, are aesthetically pleasing. I can't say that the rooms weren't small, but, you know, in almost any comparable hotel, you're not going to get any that are much larger without paying a good deal more. My room was appointed with a low queen bed, a small desk and chair, two huge wall mirrors, and three small lamps (there was no overhead lighting, which was annoying). The only place to really sit in comfort was the bed, and there was just barely enough room on either side of that to access the small end tables. The bathroom was likewise small, but clean. On that note, I'd like to issue a word of warning to anyone traveling with a companion, which involves the fact that the bathroom is separated from the rest of the room by a wall with a floor-length window, and might cause some issues for modest people (there were two thin curtains to cover it up, but they didn't really do much). The service at the hotel was not bad--certainly not the snobby, pretentious type encountered by many other reviewers--but I see how it would be easy to be intimidated by the young, hip staff. The Hudson Bar, by the way, looked to be peopled mostly with tacky types and wouldn't probably have held enough to interest most people outside the Schrager scene, but the Library Bar in the hotel was much more laid back and relaxing. In short: don't go here if you're looking for lots of space or wonderfully attentive, friendly service, but if you're young and don't mind being a little cramped in order to experience a trendy, unique hotel--and you get a good rate!--go for it.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in some great NYC hotels...this isn't one of them.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel is cool and trendy, at least superficially. The decor is impressive; the deskclerk who checked me in was polite and professional; the bar was definately happening. Scarily though, the rooms are really, really small (and that's even by NYC standards! Hard to believe). There was a an asian fusion thing going on in the tiny room that was nice and I figured it would be fine for sleeping. Unfortunately sleep was the thing I didn't get. It was winter and the steam heat they use in the hotel makes a clanking that would wake the dead. When I called the front desk in the middle of the night they said I might have better luck with the heat off. It had been oppressively hot in the room and I had never turned the heat on. When I told them this they sent and "engineer" up to help. A half hour later when he came up the noise had stopped. He promised it would not be back. It returned about 15 minutes later. Since I wasn't sleeping I made my way to the vending machines. Apparently couples from the bar use the hallways as uh..."make out" spots to put it nicely. It was especially unpleasant as you could see the carpets were badly stained from some kind of leak, despite how DARK the halls are. Needless to say, I wasn't really in the mood for the atmosphere. I would have to recommend this hotel for very skinny party people who are either deaf or intoxicated enough to pass out despite the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here for a quiet, restful evening...”
Reviews.Author: themidlifetraveler
Reviews.Content: After my 3rd stay at the Hudson, I'm retiring my frequest guest card ....it's just too noisy! I've never had a full night of sleep there... the doors slam so loud from the other guest rooms that it is just not possible to enjoy a night of rest. Besides the constant party traffic from the bar eventually making a drunken parade up to the rooms. Great looking place, just no place to be if you want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and pretentious staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A hotel that advertises itself as a chic art decor trendy place that comes under an affordable budget. Fails to mention that the rooms are so small that even the iron is designed to be placed on the bed as there is no floorspace (try ironing with a 3 foot board on a bed!). The staff at the front desk and the bar were somewhat pretentious I found and in no way as friendly as you will get a chain hotel brands. I found this hotel to reek of pretentiousness and while that may be your thing, being from LA myself, I found it even too much. The bar and facilities are open to the public so take my advice and stay in a hotel with proper size rooms and see this hotel as a non paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in a coffin, you'd be more comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: libbsjm
Reviews.Content: Do I need to say more? If you want privacy, or comfort, it's out, you can't even fit in the bathroom if you want to shut the door. The bar is nice, but that's about it. The corridors are really scary also, like something out of a Bates movie!!!! Go to the bar, if you don't mind paying $14 a drink, but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but great for a couple”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hudson for 4 days last year and had a wonderful time. We paid about $200 per night through Express Reservations.com and though our room was small, it was large enough for the two of us. The bed was really comfortable and the common areas were great. If you appreciate nice design and are willing to give up some room space for aesthetics, than this is the place. We had fun at the bar and breakfast at the restaurant was very good. Location was great as well...very central.

Reviews.Title: “honest review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere: Hip and Trendy Location: difficult to find as there is no sign that says the hotel name. Close to subway. Staff: direct and not overly friendly or enthusiastic. Public areas: good decor, hip and fun. Good if your under 30. Room: Standard room was very small. Very tight quarters. Moderately clean. Smelled like a dorm room. Modern fixtures in bathroom-but very small. Hallways were dingy and the carpet was obviously stained and smelled like smoke. Bottom line: Much to pricey for what you get ($245/night) I would stay elsewhere and just come for the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Positive perspective”
Reviews.Author: artzoop
Reviews.Content: It may be true that most people who take the time to review a place are those who have complaints, while those who enjoyed their stay are less likely to do so? If so, it would seem difficult to get a balanced opinion. In any case, as I researched where to stay in New York City for several trips I've taken in the last couple of years, I avoided staying at the Hudson because of the abundance of negative reviews. In fact, I was amazed at how many consistently negative reviews were posted at this website for the Hudson. Most of them seem to complain about the small room size and unpleasant staff. The day after New Years, as I was attending an event at the Lincoln Center with my daughter, and hotel location was very important to us, I opted to give the Hudson a try. Apprehensive of room size, I asked for a deluxe double (with two beds). Apprehensive of staff problems, I called again the day before (directly to the hotel) to confirm my reservation. Overall our stay at the Hudson was excellent. The modern design, which is impressive, I won't comment on much, for it's not why I stayed there. The room and bathroom were spacious enough and tastefully designed. Beds were very comfortable. Amenities were good (bathrobes, fluffy comforters, CD and TV choices, cool lighting). In every encounter with the staff, we were treated very courteously and felt welcome. The staff we met and dealt with included two from housekeeping, three bellmen, three front desk people, two restaurant hosts, and two waiter/waitresses. So, in dealing with 12 different staff persons (and yes, most of them were young and cool and fashionable), all of them were very nice and professional and gracious. In response to those who are wary of small room size, I suggest paying the extra $50 or whatever it is, to upgrade to a deluxe room, and maybe let the staff know your concerns by calling the hotel directly.
