In response to those wary of rude New Yorkers, don't be. I've stayed at about a dozen different hotels in New York City within the last 3 years, and would rank the Hudson staff among the best. The room, though not the most spacious or much of a window view, above average. Bed comfort excellent. Hotel design something to see, even if you're not staying there. My only negative about the Hudson is that the hallways could use new carpeting, and the restaurant ought to expand its beer selection (they had no Guinness or comparable dark beer or anything on draught).

Reviews.Title: “All Smoke and Mirrors”
Reviews.Author: RichNY62
Reviews.Content: This review is based upon two stays at the Hudson last year. Following my experiences, I believe that much of the positive feedback about this hotel stems from the visually stimulating common areas: the minimalist and futuristic entrance, the beautiful lobby, the really "cool" bar with it's yellow glass floor and couches made from logs. During my first stay at the Hudson, I was intrigued by this aspect of the hotel and overlooked all other less positive factors. True, the rooms are small, as this is New York City, but the bathrooms are unacceptably small. The dark wood floors and walls are nice and the minimalist and modern furnishings are cool, but on my second stay at the Hudson, all of the asthetic charms and the novelty had worn off. The service is less than stellar for such a allegedly "chic" hotel with the desk staff failing to providing a warm welcome one finds at real service hotels. The halls are quite dark, with a run down look from wear and tear giving the feel of being in a tenanment building. A stay last New Year's told the tale of the management of this over rated place. I booked the Hudson due to the proximity to Lincoln Center where I was attending a New Year's concert. Big mistake.This hotel was like a college dorm party. It seemed like everyone was 21 and the staff did nothing to maintain a sense of order. Beer cans in the halls with spilled drink glasses and garbage. Noisy and out of control. No concern for the paying customers was shown and for close to $300 or more a nite, it was a disgrace. All common areas were closed for partiers paying a high separate fee to have the "priviledge " to attend. No consideration was given to at least have the small library bar open for guests wanting to have a drink. Why should they when Britney Spears has paid big bucks to rent out that area for her own private party? Plus, to have the privilege of being herded in and out through a service entrance used for deliveries and trash because the lobby was closed for the big party, the experience was a nightmare and simply inexusable. No advance notice was given upon booking warning of the closing of all facilities so that mangement of this place could rake in the dough from non-guests.The Hudson may be worth a look and that's it, a look. For real service at this price there are many real hotels in town willing to provide the professionalism and service people who spend hard earned cash want and expect.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a fun place to stay in NYC. We booked a superior queen room which was plenty big enough. The bars are lots of fun and I had no problem with the staff. A tip for getting a cheaper room: we stayed close to Thanksgiving so there were no cheap deals around. However, the prices on the hotel website went down 14 days before our arrival. As there is no penalty for cancelling a booking through the hotel website, I simply cancelled and re-booked at the lower rate, saving $30/night+ tax.

Reviews.Title: “motor home would've looked like Biltmore House!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went weekend before Christmas 2003. Rooms big as walk-in closet.Bathroom small and not enough light to put on makeup.Not enough room between toilet and wall for rug to stand on when getting out of shower.No place to put luggage.One foot clearance each side of queen bed.Help down stairs very helpful. Elevator bigger than our bathroom. I am sure we could have gotten more room for our money. We went through travel agency. DON'T stay here unless you like to waste money and sleep in a shoe box.

Reviews.Title: “Low light doesn't conceal all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Word of advice: stay at a hotel with standard sized rooms and get your trendy fix by visiting the Hudson's public spaces. The Hudson takes itself so seriously it's pitiable. A brochure in the room explains the "whimsical" and symbolic nature of the design - puleeze. The whimsy ends when you discover the crass price tags on everything from the shampoo to the crappy basket that holds ammenities (all for sale). The room is only large enough to hold the bed, and if you're planning to put it to good use, you'll discover that it squeaks and creaks. The bathroom offers no privacy, so if you're modest in that department, be prepared to hold it in. The dim and dingy hallways recall the SRO that this building formerly was. As for the commentators who say, "come on, this is NYC." I lived in NYC for 20 years and have seen the inside of many a hotel in NY and worldwide. The Hudson just doesn't pay off. We had no problem with the staff, the library was fun and the martini ample. Would I stay here again? Don't be ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable But Not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hudson in August 2003 and found the overall experience to be pretty reasonable. I booked over the internet two days before arriving and was surprised to be upgraded on arrival. Maybe it's a cultural thing, but I found the staff approachable and courteous.Now on the minus side, I like some others was charged for some mystery mini bar purchases. After three phone calls it still wasn't fixed so I waited for my bill to query the charges. I'm still waiting.The public areas are nicely done and do get roudy in the evenings but I found that part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & suitably pretentious!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at start of November with my girlfriend and was expecting all kinds of problems after reading these reviews! We had a wicked time here - do not take too much notice of these bad reviews. The staff were friendly & professional and would pander to your every need. You treat them with respect and they will do the same in return. Admittedly we paid for a Queen size room but this was not much larger than a standard and there was plenty of room!!! This is New York people!! Bar was very very cool -flash the hotel card and you get very prompt service. Cool surroudings, cool music and cool people. If you are looking for a trendy hip place then this is it - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Just Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tiny, poorly designed dirty rooms with no amenities and no air circulation and cheap furniture. Terrible front desk service, poor housekeeping response, I could go on forever. Nice architecture in the lobby, though. So at least you got that going for you.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. but noisy”
Reviews.Author: PHFinCT
Reviews.Content: The hotel responded to an $80 bid on Priceline in 2002. The room was very small but clean. The decor was very hip and the double bed very low to the floor. Given the price and proximity to Lincoln Center, it seemed to be a bargain. The only real problem was the noise. There were people speaking loudly in the halls at all hours of the night. Perhaps as a result of the popular singles bar on the lobby level.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything seems fine if you can tolerate the noise coming out from the air-conditioner in the middle of night, or if you prefer to stay in a tiny room with small TV set and bath tub, or if you would like to be charged for no reason, or if you don't want to have any coffee maker in room, or if you want your head to be blown by the air-conditioner for all night, or if you like impolite staff, or...

Reviews.Title: “SURPRIZELESS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seeing it on the net was so great, but once you get there and see what you are getting for your money it was a let down. We booked a week before, and asked for upper floor, non smoking, and city view. GOT NONE OF THE ABOVE. They did up grade us to a 15th floor, on our 2nd night, but no city view. The rooms were dirty, Very small and dust everwhere! Spoke to several people staying there to see if were were being too choosey. NOT! The down stairs areas were great, pool table boxed in by collumns and couches, felt like a carom board. $50.00 per night for Valet? Come on! Halls were dirty and dark, and the carpet stained needed a little more freshener. Will not be going back. Very Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff, filthy hotel room, overpriced, overrated”
Reviews.Author: ilkajonesing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March 2002. The experience was beyond wretched then, consisting of a haughty, nasty hotel clerk who screamed at me for putting my purse on the counter and, after sizing us up, insisted that our pre-paid hotel stay reservation was not to be found. Went downhill from there. Rude staff is simply unforgiveable at a purportedly 4-star hotel, but other than 1 nice doorman and 1 nice concierge, we watched as one guest after another -- incl. those in the dining room -- were treated with utter contempt by the imperious staff. Yes, the rooms are small, but the size of the room is jarring after you're treated like scum for daring to stay at their exclusive hotel. But there was dirt everywhere in our room, including a thick layer under the bed, on the window ledge, behind the bowl of the vessel sink. And we were charged for items from the mini-bar and bathroom that we hadn't even touched. Not to mention the utter inconvenience, with no warning or apology, when the water supply was cut off for over eight hours. I did write them a letter expressing my unhappiness, and they offered me two free nights. Kind of appalling considering -- why would I want to go back? -- but I gave them one more chance. Luckily, I thought to make another reservation at the Roosevelt simultaneous with my visit to Hudson this past summer. I think the front desk staff has gotten worse but this time I was braced for it. After I crawled into my bed, something sticky greeted my feet: a used condom. I didn't even bother checking out. I simply packed up and at 10:00 pm arrived at Roosevelt, where the inquiring desk clerk heard my gruesome tale. He upgraded my room for free and had room service send me a pot of tea for which I was not charged. Now that's class, service, hospitality. Why bother with an Ian Shrager property? Never, ever stay at Hudson if you aren't forced to at gunpoint.

Reviews.Title: “See-through shower!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very hip, and yes the rooms are a bit small. The bathroom and shower are see-through! The hotel is very nice and there is a lot to do, so if you dont plan on spending much time at the hotel b/c of sight-seeing then this may not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean, but also small and dark”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in June 2003 and got more or less what we expected - the hotel is very modern and clean inside, but, outside of the lobby (I'm speaking of the rooms and adjacent hallways) it's much DARKER than you'd imagine. Our room was small, but very nice and clean and certainly a good deal ($149 internet special). Climate control in-room, little TV and stereo (with CD player), cable internet (which was simple to get up and running on my laptop), interesting bathroom with glass wall facing room (and curtain for privacy, if necessary ;). Room service was quick, attentive and courteous and the food (both from room service and the restaurant downstairs) was very good. Overall, I say stay here if you can get a room for under $250. I wouldn't have been disappointed, even at that price. PS: The disco-floored bar downstairs is good for some laughs - loads of too-old people trying to look young and hip.

Reviews.Title: “4 visits and no 'tude from the staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hudson four times in the past 1.5 years--three times for business and one personal (I took my wife for mini-getaway for the 3rd trip). In all of those visits, I have never encounted attitude from any of the staff. Front desk people have been great every visit. One night a co-worker and I were in line about 10 people deep at the Hudson Bar and just holding my room key in my hand was enough for the doorman to wave us over and let us past the line.I've noticed that the bar, most nights, is filled with monied older men with young women flirting with them and young couples. If you think the Hudson Bar staff has attitude then I suggest you hit some of the hot nightclubs around town: Centro-Fly or The Roxy for example.As others have written, yeah, the room is small---so, if after reading these reviews and you still complain about the size of the room, you're a ninny!And, if you made the trip to NYC to spend any quality time in the hotel room then you should save yourself a trip and stay home! Most people use NYC hotel rooms to just sleep!It's a hip, young-end hotel. If I was visiting NYC with my parents, I wouldn't stay here. But as a 33 year old in the music/radio industry, I think it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hudson Hotel is a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been to several bars at the Ian Scharger Hotels and we thought we should stay at one of his hotels next time we're visiting NY. We chose the Hudson hotel in Manhatten and what a terrible experience that was. First of all, the hotel doesn't have a sign, so if you have never been to Hudson, you have to guess or ask someone. The foyer and the bar and patio are nice, but not as great as we thought. We paid $300 for one night and our room was so tiny that we started laughing once we entered the room. The bathroom was so small that we had trouble sitting on the toilet. The room was absolutely terrible. The bed didn't have a mattress, but a hard futon. If you are planning to stay at a nice hotel save yourself the headache and stay at Waldorf Astoria or at Millenium. I would not recommend Hudson to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it - the hotel that is...”
Reviews.Author: citychicky
Reviews.Content: I liked it - mostly...We wanted to spend a night in NYC as a little vacation over Labor Day weekend and decided to spring for a room at the Hudson Hotel. Architecturally, it is a really nice and interesting place to stay. The outdoor patio was comfortable and pleasant. The room was small but the design is so good looking and the bed was incredibly comfortable. It was also very clean. The hotel staff was nice. The neighborhood was great, we left and walked around Lincoln center and found a great place to eat just 5 blocks away. The park is right there too. The only thing I didnt like was the other patrons. When we were in the bar and on the patio early in the night is was great but when we came back from dinner at 12 it was packed and no one was allowed out on the patio anymore. People were around trying to be fabulous and not really pulling it off. It was like being in a bad club. That being said, we were able to get a few beers and find a nice spot in the hallway - there are many places to sit (for 2) and people watch. Overall, the hotel was interesting to look at, the Saturday night scene was a bit much, and the rooms were cool. A nice place to stay for a night or two if you want a little vacation in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Mondrian in L.A. (another Ian hotel) where the staff was pretentious, but hey I was in Hell-ay! The Hudson was great from when we checked in. Yes the rooms were tiny but I anticipated that going in based on other reviews. Everyone was wrong on the staff. Yes it's a little annoying showing your guest card everytime you go upstair but because the Hudson Bar turns into somewhat of a club in the evening they do it so people aren't running through the halls of your $155/night 144 sq. ft. rooms. The security team did suggest when to come to the bar, escorted us to the door, and even took care of our drinks all night long. Which ended up being 6 Midori Sours, 1 rum & coke, and 1 Shirley Temple. They told us who the regulars where, and who to stay away from. Also we were told of a private party the next evening. I think if people treated the staff as actually people and not lower class citizens they'd get better results.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Stylish”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hudson Hotel as part of a special evening for my boyfriend who loves places that look modern, contemporary, and stylish. The Hudson is definitely one of those places. I paid $220 (without taxes and add-ons) for a deluxe room with a bigger bathroom; buffet breakfast was included the next day. Yeah, it's a little pricey, but staying at a hotel that had a chic, youthful, vibrant sort of sex appeal was worth it. It's great for people-watching, the Private Park bar area was fun, the decor is tasteful and whimsical, and I don't think room size is really an issue unless you're planning to spend all your time in there. But why would you in a city like New York where there are so many other things to do?? I have read reviews where people complained about the service, but my experience with the staff was pleasant enough. There are a mix of people here, but I'd say most are relatively young and trendy and in their 20s, 30s, early 40s. If you're not into a place that is a "scene" or want a more traditional room a la something at the Four Seasons, this isn't the hotel for you. For something fun and hip with some quirkiness, try the Hudson.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A disaster with the booking arrangements on arrival meant much of our first evening was spent on the phone to the tour operators British Airways in the UK (mistakes happen!). The staff at this hotel were extremely abrasive in their manner and seemed reluctant to assist us. We were asked to make calls from hotel reception and were initially told that they would be charged to our account. My travelling Companion was reduced to tears by the whole episode. The problem was resolved by the intervention of British Airways who funded a complete room upgrade. A massive thank you and congratulations to British Airways for your excellent client care! A charge made to my account for a disposable camera from the mini-bar which was never used, was quickly refunded when I brought this mistake to the attention of the relevant parties.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Chic New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenverTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great New York hotel. Enjoy the bar on the lobby floor and be sure to enjoy breakfast on the beautiful patio.

Reviews.Title: “why?”
Reviews.Author: writerscircle
Reviews.Content: Why on earth did anyone think that it was a good idea to design an hotel where comfort doesn't enter the equation. I stay all over the world and I dearly loved New York but the Hudson? Oh dear, it's fine as long as you don't want to turn around in your bedroom or are happy to just stay in bed, there are no drawers to put clothes, the bathroom is tiny, the lighting inadequate unless you happen to be a mole, the bar-pretentious and overpriced and the service-indifferent. Save your money, forget trendy, go somewhere cheaper and think comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've read all the reviews on the Hudson. After having stayed there as part of our honeymoon in late June, we can both say that we loved it. We stayed in a studio suite, which was lovely. Breakfast in bed was the highlight for us. The CD stereo system was great, room service was always with a smile, and the bar and restaurant were terrific. We would stay there again without thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 1st anniversary in New York in early June, and we had an outstanding time, not to mention a wonderful experience at the Hudson Hotel. We stayed Friday through Tuesday, and enjoyed every minute of it. There was no wait to get into the bar on Sat. night for us. Since we were guests, we were given passes that allowed us to forgo the line. Our room was clean and sleek. If you are not used to city traffic and noise, which we are not, ask to be placed on a higher floor. We stayed on the 14th floor and had no problems with noise whatsoever. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly to us. From the desk attendants, to the concierge, bartenders and everyone else we encountered who worked there, we didn't experience any of the rudeness I have heard so much of. I think this hotel is definitely for the young. My husband and I are 25/23, and we felt very comfortable and satisfied at the Hudson. Yes, the rooms are small, but it's New York!!! Get out and do something.
